1.title: Start

11.content: Byleth is the blank faced silent protagonist, who stumbles their way into a job as a professor at Garreg Mach Monastery. A talented mercenary, they prove to be a great teacher leading a future generation of knights. Though, their authority may be bolstered or challenged depending on their new size.
11.title: Byleth: The Ashen Demon

111.content:
"You know what? Even with all this training and all this battling, I'm not really seeing any sort of advancement in your skills." Sothis yawned as she leaned down on one arm of her throne, gazing down at Byleth.

"What do you mean? Of course my skills are becoming sharper! I've gotten so much stronger since coming here!" He argued, not really understanding where the sleeping deity was coming from with any of this nonsense.

"Oh please, you couldn't have even handled that monster last week without the aid of your students. Face it, you're dependent on them. I want you to be strong enough that you can challenge and defeat any foes BY YOURSELF! And I'm afraid these trivial little skirmishes won't be enough to buff you up for future conflicts!" Sothis sighed, sitting up right as she looked back down at Byleth once more.

"With all that said, I believe it's time I take your training into my hands, personally. From this point on for the rest of the month, I'll cast a very unique magic spell upon you. You'll be affected by it for the entire month, and you'll be forced to survive its afflictions on and off the battlefield, is that understood?" The green haired girl asked. Byleth stood silent for a moment or two, pondering the girl's words. Maybe she was right? Maybe he did need extra training in order to become stronger.

"Just for the month? Right?" He asked, breaking the silence.

"Yup, just one month and I'll lift the spell from you." Sothis nodded, raising a brow down at the boy.

"Fine... alright, hit me with it." Byleth said confidantly, ready for his friend's little 'training' to begin.

"Glad to see you're so eager.. but.. I don't think you'll be so confident when you see what kind of spell I use on you~" Sothis giggled as she raised her arm forward, her palm facing him as a golden aura began to glow from her hand. Within a matter of seconds, the boy was blasted with a stream of powerful magic and he was sent back to the world above...

----

"G-GAAH! Byleth sat up, his heart pounding as he awoke from his dream and communion with Sothis.

"Goddess.. last time I agree to something as stupid as that..." The professor said to himself as he pushed some covers away, though finding it somewhat harder to do so. Lifting her hand up to his face, Byleth rubbed his eyes, trying to regain his eye sight for the coming day. But as things came into focus... something seemed.. different?

"Wha?! What the?!" Byleth looked in awe and wonder as the world around him had grown to gigantic sizes.. or he had shrunken, that was another possibility. Turning around, he saw that his pillow was much larger than even a house now!

"Sothis, what did you do?!" He said to himself in panic as he stood up, now seeing his own bed as a landmass now. A quick estimate put him at roughly two inches tall as he compared himself to his surroundings.

"I.. I gotta get help!" Byleth quickly ran to the edge of the bed where the blanket reached all the way down to the floor. That would be his way down, but what he didnt know is who he would try and connect with...
111.title: A gods training

1111.content:
Byleth knew that if he wanted to survive a month at this size, he needed help from one of his students. Fortunately, from his personal quarters, he was relatively close to where his students would be at this time of day.

Of all the students, the one closest in proximity would be Bernadetta. Byleth knew she would be hiding in her room like she always did. He wasn't sure how much help she would be though. Bernie was scared of everything and everyone. If she heard a voice without seeing the speaker, she would probably think her room was haunted. If she saw his tiny form, she might pass out thinking he was a bug or a mouse before she recognized him.

If he didn't go for Bernadetta, he could likely find Dorothea in her room as well. It was early in the day, so she was probably putting her makeup on and getting dressed to make sure she caught the attention of every guy she walked past. He knew Dorothea would take good care of him if she found him, but for that to happen she would have to notice him. She had a tendency to sing to herself when in her room, and which would make yelling her name difficult. And, as much as it embarrassed Byleth to think this, he had a feeling that Dorothea's.... assets would make it a bit harder for her to see something down at her feet.

If he was willing to make a longer trek, there was also Petra and Edelgard. He wasn't certain, but if he had to guess he figured Petra would be training in the training area just a bit north of his room, and Edelgard would likely be doing some work in the Black Eagles classroom.

If he chose Petra, he was sure the kind foreign girl would do her best to aid him. However, he worried that the language barrier may cause her to misunderstand what she wanted from him. Plus, if she was training, it would be hardest of all to get her attention.

If he chose Edelgard, he'd have to make a pretty long trek, but she would likely be the best person to help him of all. She was smart, resourceful, and had the resources of the entire Adrestian empire at her disposal. And Byleth knew she liked him a lot. If anything, she might have liked him too much.

Who does Byleth decide to go looking for?
1111.title: His students, the Black Eagles!

choices: Bernadetta feels something moving underneath her foot.
Bernadetta gets up to grab food in the dining hall, taking Byleth with her.
Bernadetta's foot moves, giving Byleth the opportunity to climb her.
11111.content:
(And the puns begin.)

Byleth considered his options and decided to go with his surefire bet with Bernadetta. The shrinking violet was almost guaranteed to be in her room. And if she wasn’t, she’d certainly return soon. The other benefit was that he didn’t have to move that far. All he had to do was go south, and he’d eventually stop just in front of his shy student’s room. It certainly beat going through crowded footpaths to get to the Black Eagles classroom. The less time he spent near the boots of his students, the better.

The trek to Bernadetta’s room was uneventful. It gave him the opportunity to get accustomed to his new stature. The same paths he walked every day were now an incomprehensible scale. He had to give it to Sothis. She found a way to make these slow days at Garreg Mach interesting.

He stopped just short of the door leading to Bernie’s room. At least once a week, he’d stop and check in on her, and she’d turn him away. Now at his current size, he could just bypass the door entirely. Sure, it was an invasion of privacy and most likely a breach of proper conduct for a professor. However, he needed the help before he ended up a stain on the floor. He just hoped he didn’t catch her in a compromising position. He got down and crawled his way through the bottom opening of the door.

Thankfully, Bernadetta seemed to just be resting on her bed, happily reading away. She lay on her back with one foot dangling off the edge of the bed.

Byleth considered his option on how to get his attention and came up with a simple flow chart as he walked over to her bed.

“Bernadetta!” He called. There was no response. He tried calling her name again, but it seemed she was just too engrossed in her book. No matter how many times he called out for her, she was lost in the whatever story she was reading.

Sighing, Byleth moved onto to plan B. He stared a bit too long at his pupil’s socked foot. He wasn’t too enthused about having to go near them, but he was lacking any reasonable options.

Her black socks went up to her knees, giving him ample space to climb his way up. Though, he would decide to do that after he prodded the giant student’s foot, hoping to forego the climbing and get her attention now.

Byleth rolled his arms before swinging, punching at the ball of Bernadetta’s foot. She didn’t react, and the shrunken professor found himself wishing that he had trained his brawling skills with Catherine instead of his swordplay. At most, her toes twitched, a subconscious reaction as the giant girl paid him no mind.

Then disaster struck as the weight of Bernadetta’s foot came crashing down on him. It knocked the wind from his lungs, sending Byleth sputtering for air beneath the wall of cotton. He didn’t notice it from now, but there was a slight stale scent in the air. Now that it was all that he could breathe for the time being, he definitely realized it was her feet.

He squirmed against the weight, feeling absolutely helpless that all it took was the unintentional shift of his meekest student to overpower him. Sothis was right, only in the sense that she rigged the entire scenario against him. He could have sword he heard snickering in the deep recessed of his mind.

Byleth continued to fight, refusing to give up and let the Goddess inside him win.
11111.title: Bern Notice

choices: "...MONSTER!" Bernadetta flees from her room, leaving Byleth there.
"...MONSTER!" Bernadetta redoubles her efforts to kill Byleth.
"...a tiny person! Wait... PROFESSOR?!" Bernadetta recognizes Byleth.
111111.content:
As Bernadetta continued to relax in bed, reading some romance novel Dorothea had left in the classroom that she'd been unable to work up the courage to return, she was snapped out of her escapism by a strange tickle. Thinking her socked foot had just rested against a rough part of the stone floor, she experimentally dragged her foot closer to the bed as she tried to find a more comfortable spot for it.

For Byleth, this was pure agony as Bernadetta inadvertently dragged him across the stone floor with her foot. He struggled to grasp onto something as he was forced into a painful roll, feeling both the giant socked foot and the hard stone grinding into him. Out of desperation, he began struggling even more, punching and kicking at Bernadetta's sole in a last ditch effort to get her to notice him.

Up above, Bernadetta's eyes widened. Whatever her foot had come in contact with was clearly alive.

"YEEEEEK!"

As a kneejerk response, her foot lurched away from the floor as she crouched on her bed. Out of the corner of her eye, she saw something small scurrying near the corner of the bed. Screaming again, she threw her book at it.

Byleth didn't even have a chance to react before the leather bound missile slammed into him. Mercifully avoiding breaking anything, he nonetheless was pinned down, trapped between the floor and a surprisingly lurid written description of the exploits of someone named Prince Chrom. Apparently, he was well hung. And sex on top of a pegasus, while ill-advised, was still possible.

"Oh my god, oh my god, there's a mouse in here..." Bernadetta fretted, eyes locked on the discarded book in the middle of the floor. "P-professor Byleth is going to find out I've been secretly eating cake in my room! He's going to tell the monks, and they're going to make me clean the whole monastery! While everyone JUDGES me!"

Meanwhile, the quiet snickering in the back of Byleth's mind had grown into full fledged laughter.

"The mighty son of Jeralt, felled by a harlequin romance novel," Sothis tutted between giggles. "Clearly, I was right, Byleth. Being a teacher has done nothing for your skills. Can you not even escape on your own?"

Byleth refused to dignify the ghost girl in his head with a response as he continued to squirm his way out. After what felt like an eternity, he managed to get one of his arms free, waving it out from under the book as he tried to struggle out of it.

Bernadetta shrieked again as she saw something under the book move.

"Oh no, it's still alive! I... I have to destroy the evidence!" Thinking quickly, she grabbed one of her boots from the foot of the bed and slowly crept from the book, brandishing it above her like a weapon. "S-sorry, Mister Mouse! It's either you or me!"

"How have Chrom and this Sumia woman not plummeted to their demise?" Sothis wondered before she and Byleth heard the sound of Bernadetta's booming footsteps slowly coming closer. "Uh-oh. Byleth, you need to find a way to let her know you aren't a rodent before she kills us both! Assuming I'm not already a ghost, but this is not the way I wish to find out!"

"Hang on... I've got an idea..." Byleth grunted as he focused his attention onto his free hand. With so many members of Black Eagle house taking an interest in magic, he had been forced to learn it himself if he wanted to be a good teacher for his students. While he wasn't quite at Professor Hanneman's level, or even Hubert, Lindhart, or Dorothea's if he were completely honest, he had still learned enough at this point to perform a basic fire spell.

Up above, Bernadetta gasped in shock as Dorothea's book suddenly began to catch fire.

"SINCE WHEN CAN MICE BREATHE FIRE?!"

Her eyes widened as her gaze zeroed in on the tiny creature burning a whole through the book.

"That... that isn't a mouse at all! It's... it's a..."
111111.title: The Temperature at Which Books Bern

choices: Bernadetta reluctantly agrees and takes Byleth to Edelgard.
Bernadetta still refuses, opting to spend alone time with the tiny Byleth.

1111113.content:
(Minor spoilers for Bernadetta's supports)

"That isn't a mouse at all... it's a tiny person!" Bernadetta gasped as she looked closer at the strange minuscule invader. Recognizing a familiar head of green hair, she knelt down, the boot in her hand dropped haphazardly to the side. "Wait... PROFESSOR?!"

"Hello, Bernadetta!" Byleth called out as he finally freed himself from the flaming book. "I promise I'll explain everything, but first, can you help me put out this fire? I don't want it to spread to the rest of your room!"

Bernadetta hurriedly nodded before donning her discarded boot and smothering out the blaze with several well placed stomps. As Byleth recoiled from the quakes, he paled as it occurred to him that absolutely nothing would have prevented her from doing that while he was still trapped beneath the flaming book.

"That... could have been bad," he muttered.

"I would have rewound time if that had occurred, do not worry," Sothis assured him. "Although that would have meant you failed the training. I also certainly would have mocked you for being crushed to death by your meekest student for quite some time."

"Thanks, Sothis," Byleth muttered sarcastically.

"We'll discuss your impertinence and lack of proper gratitude later," Sothis said snidely. "For now, I'll leave you to discuss matters with your student."

"P-professor?" Bernadetta's voice got the professor's attention as Sothis faded back to the recesses of his mind. "Wh-what happened to you? How are you so small?"

"It's a training exercise," Byleth said cryptically, deciding that trying to explain Sothis and her powers to any of his students would result in them thinking he was crazy at best and getting dissected by the Church at worst.

"T-training exercise? D-did the Knights shrink you?! Can they do that?!" Bernadetta swallowed nervously. "Will they do it to us too?!"

"No! Nothing like that!" Byleth waved his hands in an effort to assuage her. "Bernadetta, can you pick me up so I don't have to shout?"

"O-okay..." Somewhat reluctantly, Bernadetta held out her hand for the shrunken professor to climb onto. Byleth did so, and felt his stomach lurch as Bernadetta carried him to her desk, her hand violently trembling all the while. Once he was on the desk and she was able to sit and lean close enough to still hear as he spoke normally, he gave her a somewhat edited version of how he'd ended up two inches tall and in her room.

"S-so my room was just closest," Bernadetta sighed. "Yeah, that... that makes more sense than you coming in my room to..." she suddenly jerked upward.

"Bernadetta? What is it?"

"I HAVEN'T BEEN SECRETLY EATING CAKE!" she yelled.

"Bernadetta, it's okay," Byleth assured her. "I don't care. Lots of students eat in their rooms. It's fine. You're not in trouble." Having learned recently why Bernadetta acted the way she did, Byleth resolved to always be as patient with the shy lavender-haired girl and her insecurities as possible (as well as murder her father as soon as the opportunity presented itself, though that was less relevant right now).

That said, he did need to hurry this conversation along.

"Bernadetta, do you mind taking me to Edelgard?"

"E-Edelgard?" Bernadetta swallowed. "Wh-why do you need to talk to Edelgard?"

"Since she's the head of Black Eagle house, she needs to know I'll be like this for a month so we can plan around it," Byleth explained patiently. "She's usually studying alone in the classroom around this time, so you shouldn't have to talk to anyone else."

"B-but if this is Edelgard's alone time, she definitely won't want to see me!" Bernadetta fretted. "She got really mad when she caught me following her a few days ago, and she hates me now! She'll throw me in an Imperial dungeon if I bother her!"

"No, she won't," Byleth insisted, choosing to table the question of why Bernadetta was following Edelgard around for now. "I promise she doesn't hate you. She tries to be a good leader for everyone in the Black Eagles. If anything, in our conversations, she's said she worries about you."

"That's even worse! I'm such a burden to everyone around me!" Bernadetta wailed. "I even almost killed you earlier!"

"But you didn't, and I'm fine," Byleth gestured to himself. "See?"

Bernadetta whimpered.

"Bernadetta, we've been over this," Byleth sighed. "If you're going to do well at this school, you need to learn to talk to the other students and teachers without panicking."

Bernadetta whimpered louder.

"You can talk to me, can't you?"

"You're different," Bernadetta looked down at Byleth fondly. "I... I don't know why, but you're different. I feel... safe... around you."

She began absently petting Byleth with her finger. Byleth remained impassive as the massive digit ruffled his hair and clothing.

"I don't know how you're able to handle this," Bernadetta mused. "Everything must be so big and scary to you. You're so brave, Professor!"

"You can be, too, Bernadetta," Byleth gently urged her. "And you can start by going out and telling Edelgard about me."

Bernadetta swallowed nervously as she looked from Byleth to her closed door...

111111313.content:
Bernadetta wasn't all too pleased by Edelgard's logic. She was especially displeased by the empire's future ruler cuddling the professor close to her bosom and petting him on the head. For some odd reason all these actions internally made her upset. Before she could even make a case to be the one to take care of the professor, the telltale sound of footsteps drew near.

Someone was coming and they'd arrive any second. Bernadetta and Edelgard panicked. Just what were they supposed to do? They couldn't let anyone see Byleth in this weakened state. They needed to hide him and fast. The snow haired girl scanned high and low around the room and silently cursed at how far spread out everything was. She continued her search for a hiding spot until her eyes landed on something rather... unexpected.

That was certainly a creative place to hid a tiny person. It was close, compact, and no one would think to look in there. But at the same time it also made Edelgards cheeks flush in embarrassment. Could she actually do this? Could she really bring herself to hide her teacher in there?

The answer was a resounding... NO!

So she went for the next best thing. She reached over to the stuttering mess that was Berndetta. Said girl yelped in shock as Edelgard used her free hand to force down her shirt collar. "Please forgive me for this!" In one swift motion she dropped their shrunken teacher down Bernadetta's shirt and into her cleavage.

The purple haired girl gasped in shock and embarrassment as she felt her tiny professor slide down deep into her twin canyons. The contact felt good, but also left her embarrassed beyond all belief! Why did El have to go and that?!

Right before she could say more the classroom door opened to reveal none other than Hubert.

1111113131.content:
Bernadetta was mentally screaming, partly from the tiny professor against her breasts and partly from the fact that Hubert had just entered the room. Thankfully, from her general anxious demeanor, Hubert wasn’t tipped off that something was wrong.

“Lady Edelgard, there’s something pertinent we must discuss.” He glared at Bernadetta. “Alone.”

Bernadetta let out a startled yelp and quickly fled the room, despite Edelgard’s silent protests.

The shy student took this as an opportunity to run and hide. Once the imperial princess was free, there was no doubt that she would try to find her. She racked her brain for somewhere to hide out, knowing that her room or Byleth’s were not good options if she wanted to keep the professor to herself.

It didn’t help that Byleth kept squirming. He had accidentally burrowed his way between her breasts in an attempt to dig his way out. She had to fight the urge to scream and pull him out as other students gave her weird looks. Meanwhile, the got his leg caught between the mounds, and it seemed he was slipping further into the crevice. With each step, it seemed like he was going to be swallowed alive, never to be heard from again.

“K-keep still, Professor,” she said under her breath once she got out of ear shot. “I tried giving you to Edelgard, and she gave you back to me.”

As she made her way through Garreg Mach, she thought of one place where she could be alone and rushed towards it, inadvertently squishing her teacher between her boobs again.
1111113131.title: Crawling on Her Skin

11111131311.content:
Bernadetta gulped nervously as she poked her head into the library. Looking around cautiously, she found the knowledge center to be empty. That was rather odd considering at the very least Annette would be fast asleep at a table. And yet, even she was missing from this picture.

That was just perfect for the recluse. She and the professor could be completely alone where Edelgard wouldn't find them. The meek girl slowly slid into the room and silently closed the door behind her. It was just her now. Her, the books, and the professor.

Speaking of the professor... Bernadetta made her way to the very back of the library and found an empty seat obscured by a large bookcase. It was the ideal spot to stay hidden even if someone ventured in. The shy archer hastily sat down as she felt her shrunken professor struggling again.

His constant struggles between her breasts left her face a bright shade of crimson. He just felt so good. A part of her was actually tempted to leave him be for a few more minutes, but then more rational part of her brain kicked in. What was she thinking just now!? She couldn't leave the professor in there.

Carefully she grabbed the collar of her shirt and gently slid it down. Bernie felt her breath hitch as again she could feel the professor descending deeper into her bosom. From what she could tell he was already in there deep as she couldn't see him from her angle. Knowing what had to be done... She reached into her chest.

Byleth meanwhile was fighting to dig himself free, and was failing miserably. His student's chest was akin to that of quicksand, the more he struggled the quicker and deeper he descended. He still could hardly believe Edelgard had deposited him in here in her haste. "At least she apologized." he told himself.

In between Bernadetta's cleavage was warm and seemed to be getting warmer still. Not to mention it was also a bit cramped at sweaty. The sweat ensuring he sunk deeper in and was marked by it's owner. Overall it was an unpleasant experience. It also didn't help that Sothis was laughing at his expense.

Eventually light began to flood his vision, looking up he could see to massive fingers headed his way. Was he finally being retrieved from this sweaty prison? If so it was about time. Byleth might've been patient by nature, but even he had his limits. He allowed the fingers to grip him and slowly he found himself ascending for the first time.

Fresh air soon filled his lungs and he soon found himself placed down gently on aa wooden surface. Looking up he could see Bernadetta looking down at him with concern like earlier. It would seem he was back at square one.

Oh joy.

11111132.content:
"I...I...I'm sorry professor I just can't. If I take you to Edelgard she'll take you away then I'll have no one to talk to" Bernadetta quickly blurted out.

Byleth sighed, remembering just how dependant Bernadetta was on him. "Bernie, I'll stay with you for a little bit to talk, but afterwards you have to take me to Edelgard. I promise I'll come back to see you later."

Bernadetta looked back at the professor, a lonely look on her face. "Promise?"

112.content:
(Post Chapter 4, very minor spoilers.)

“I knew that coming back here was a bad idea! I should never have agreed to this!” Jeralt threw his hands in the air, the strong reaction surprising everyone present.. “I thought something strange was going to happen while we were here, but I did not guess that it would involve my son being reduced to a size smaller than a doll.”

“Oh my.” Byleth heard Sothis’ voice in the back of his mind. “I have never seen your father so upset. I assumed he was the type to not let anything get to him. Though I suppose I cannot blame him, this is certainly a strange predicament you’ve found yourself in.”

Byleth simply nodded, just as surprised as Sothis was about both his father and new size. He hadn’t expected this to happen to him after his latest mission. He and his class were able to see through a mysterious group’s threat of assassinating the archbishop and find them raiding the Holy Mausoleum. They managed to rout the thieves, yet the last one managed to open one of the tombs and steal the artifact inside.

Fortunately Byleth was able to reclaim the artifact and use it to defeat the thief, though that was what apparently caused his new predicament. Last he remembered, he was having a conversation with his class’ leader before suddenly collapsing. When he woke, he was in Professor’s Manuela’s office stripped of his armor and the artifact. Now he was currently in the Archbishop’s office, standing on a table that had been brought in for him. The only people present were his father, Flayn, Seteth, Lady Rhea, and himself.

It was here that he learned the artifact he wielded was called the “Sword of the Creator”. It was apparently the weapon of Nemesis, a significant figure in Fodlan's history and leader of the original ten lords of Fodlan. It was apparently a very powerful artifact and, for now, it was determined that it had something to do with Byleth’s shrinking.

“Please calm yourself Sir Jeralt!” Flayn spoke before Rhea or Seteth. “We had no way of knowing something like this would happen, we do not want the professor to come to any harm.” She wanted to speak further, but a motion from Seteth caused her to go quiet.

Jeralt calmly shook his head at the girl. “I believe you. I don’t suspect anyone in the church having foul intent for my son, I am merely frustrated that this somehow happened under the church’s watch.” He didn't entirely believe the words himself, but Jeralt figured that no one currently in the room wanted to harm his son directly.

“I understand your frustration, Jeralt. If anything happened to Flayn I would be furious beyond reconciliation,” Seteth began, hoping his feelings for Flayn would resonate with Jeralt’s own, “But you must understand that the knights had to attend to Lady Rhea. If the assassination threat had been true, then not having every knight available present would’ve been too much of a risk.”

Jeralt let an exhausted sigh escape him as he rolled his neck, trying to relax. He knew that was the kind of answer he would get, but he was hoping the church would own up in some way or offer a solution. His attention was drawn to Rhea as she began speaking.

“Jeralt, what happened in the tombs that night is an unprecedented occurrence. It was thought that no one would be able to wield the Sword of the Creator again, yet your child was able to wield it.” She spoke with a sense of awe in her voice.

“And, apparently, because of that sword he’s smaller than the average doll. Two very strange things happened to my son happened last night.”

“Indeed. It is true that those without the proper crest are not supposed to be able to wield that crest’s weapon, but there have never been reports of side effects such as this.”

Byleth, figuring now would be a good time to interject, spoke, “So was I not compatible with the sword? I know for certain that I used it to strike down one of the thieves.”

“We have confirmed that you did wield the sword, though even those without crests can use artifacts for a time. Your students confirmed that for us. As for your reduced stature, professor Manuela was the one who saw that come to pass while you were in the infirmary."

“And where have you put the relic? Back inside of its tomb?”

“No, we deemed that unwise.” Rhea jumped into the conversation. “For now it is being kept in close proximity to me. We must have it on hand if we are to figure out what it has done to you. Professor Hanamen and Seteth have begun looking into it.”

Byleth nodded, though he doubted anyone could see it. “Fair enough. Just be careful, I would hate for this to happen to anyone else.” He paused for a moment before talking to Jeralt. “Father, just so you know, I do not regret my decision. The results were not perfectly ideal, but who knows what could have happened if I didn’t act.”

“My my, I do believe that’s the first I’ve heard you call Jeralt ‘father’. Feeling emotional?” Quipped Sothis.

“Ugh, I know you don’t.” Jeralt replied, fully expecting that from his son. “So what are we supposed to do now? Just wait for the church to find a cure?”

“No, I can’t just wait around.” Byleth spoke before anyone answered his father’s questions. “I will continue to teach my students. I can’t do anything physical, but I can always impart knowledge.”

Everyone present looked at Byleth with a shocked expression, except for Jeralt whose face was buried into his hand. “I knew you’d say that.” Jeralt had noticed since Byleth first became a professor that he’d changed. For some reason the kids really resonated with him, they were very special to Byleth. Not even his current ridiculous predicament would keep him away from them.

“Are you daft!? Do you understand how fragile you are now!? These students of yours cannot be worth the dangers teaching them would entail!” Sothis shouted, the sound of her voice very forward in Byleth's head now.

“I am well aware of my fragility, but I cannot abandon my students! If you were listening, you would’ve heard I have no plans to engage in anything physical. I will simply give the lectures. My students are fully capable of handling the other tasks.”

Unaware of the conversation Byleth was having, Seteth and Rhea discussed his request between themselves. Flayn silently pouted beside them, well aware that she had no say in the matter. Hearing Byleth’s eager request only made her desire for a life among the students grow stronger.

The two took quite a bit of time to debate. Though everyone present knew that Rhea would get some version of whatever she wanted. The two eventually stopped discussing and separated. Clearing his throat, Seteth spoke. “Very well. We will allow you to continue to lecture your students. As you said, you must avoid any physical training with your students; even magic or archery. You will be required to have an escort with you at all times as well. We will provide you with one, assuming you do not find one for yourself.”

“And will I be considered for the position?” Jeralt asked.

A shake of the head was Seteth’s reply. “You will not. You are the acting captain of the knights of Seiros. You would not be able to watch Byleth at all times.”

Jeralt shrugged his shoulders. “I figured that would be the case. I can’t complain I suppose, I barely had time to look out for the boy when he was normal size since I got here.”

Understanding that his request had been granted, Byleth bowed slightly. “Thank you for allowing me to keep up my lectures. I haven’t been here very long, but I feel a connection with my students that I couldn’t leave unattended.”

Rhea nodded, a caring smile on her face. “I understand. You have grown quite close with your students in a short time. Just be careful, you are an important member of the faculty and we cannot lose you.”

“Of course, I will choose my escort well. Now… I will need help to get to my classroom. Class should be beginning soon unless I misjudged the time of day.”

Flayn was going to volunteer for the task, but was interrupted by Jeralt. “I’ll drop him off. I’m sure the other professors are setting up for their classes, I wanted to speak to them about him.” Flayn sadly put her hands behind her back, trying not to look too disappointed.

Wordlessly, Jeralt placed a hand near his shrunken son, knowing he would know what to do. Byleth quickly thanked Rhea, Seteth, and Flayn for their time and climbed onto his father’s hand. He was quickly moved to Jeralt’s shoulder and he took a moment to get his footings. Once he was sure they were ready, Jeralt left the room, sparing no words for Rhea or Seteth. “You know, I did miss the days when you rode on my shoulders.” Jeralt’s voice could be heard outside of the office, “But I never figured it would happen again, especially like this.”

Thankfully the trip to Byleth’s classroom was uneventful, not a soul stopped to bother Jeralt about anything. And apparently no one noticed the shrunken professor. Before either knew it, Jeralt and Byleth arrived in his classroom. For now, all Byleth had to focus on was teaching his class.

Which class did Byleth have to teach?
112.title: Dedicated to the Job

1122.content:
Byleth was dropped off in his classroom with some time to spare before his lectures were scheduled to start. Jeralt dropped him off on his desk, avoiding complaining about the situation to Byleth. It wouldn’t do his son any good, so he decided to let it go for the time being. “You stay safe now, alright? Don’t try anything foolish.”

Byleth gave his father an amused look. “You’re saying I shouldn’t challenge any of my students to a duel?”

“You know what I mean. Also, whoever ends up as your chaperone, I want you to bring them to my office. I need to make sure you’re in good hands.”

“I’ll try to keep that in mind… honestly, I might forget. I’ll have a lot to figure out.” Byleth sighed.

“Just figure out how to stay safe, that’ll be good enough for me. I’ll visit when I get the chance.” With that, Jeralt left, eager to finish whatever tasks he had assigned to him so he could look for help. Though he knew that he would likely be given every task possible to keep him busy.

Now alone, Byleth took his time to think of a way to explain his current predicament to his class. From what he was told, his students had only seen him collapse and had missed the part where he shrunk. He didn’t have a logical explanation for that. Say that an ancient, magic sword shrunk him sounded ridiculous, even if that was apparently the truth. There was no better explanation though, so his students would have to accept that explanation just like he did. Hopefully they’d take the news well, but he had a few students he figured wouldn’t.

As Byleth thought about what to say to his class, he anxiously watched the entrance to see who would come in first. Ideally the class would come in one at a time or in small groups; that way he could tell the story to one person and then they could tell it to the others. It would be a slower but more effective way to get the information out. Byleth’s hopes for that would be dashed when his students all filed into the room at once. “So much for that idea.”

“Did anyone bother to confirm if the professor was even going to be here?” Felix asked, taking his normal seat near the back of the room. "I'm not going to waste time with a substitute, especially after seeing our professor wield an artifact. I must test myself against that strength."

“I did not receive word of a substitute being arranged, so we should expect him to be here.” Dimitri informed everyone. “I expect everyone to be on their best behavior. The professor should be resting, instead he’s decided to continue his lectures. We should appreciate his dedication." Dedue silently nodded, agreeing with his liege like he always did.

“I wouldn’t mind if the professor took some time off. Would give me some more… free time.” Sylvain spoke, a smirk on his face. The people who didn't ignore him rolled their eyes, wondering why he was bothering trying to hide what he wanted to do during "free time".

“Ugh. I think all the girls in the monastery owe the professor a big thanks.” Groaned Ingrid, pushing Sylvain towards a seat. "Of course he's also keeping me stuck here with you so maybe I'm the one making a sacrifice?"

Sylvain leaned back in his chair smoothly and laughed. "Come on, you know you like sitting next to me. You couldn't ask for better company."

"I think I'd rather sit next to that scarecrow you hit on a while ago."

"Wha-hey! Don't bring that up in here!" The lecherous red head protested.

Ashe, who had been trying to ignore the conversation, laughed quietly to himself. "Sylvain is quite a character." He mused as he got his materials for class ready on his desk. He planned on putting extra effort into his studies today, hoping the extra effort would be seen as a sign of appreciation for the professor's dedication.

“I hope this wasn’t all somehow my fault.” Mercedes mused to herself, feelings of regret creeping in her thoughts. “I didn’t really do well with the healing that night.” The gentle girl somehow had convinced herself that the professor's collapse was caused by her neglect. Truthfully, she had performed as well as she always did, but the fact that her professor had collapsed put many negative thoughts in her head.

Annette gently patted her on the back. “Don’t be silly Mercie! You did great like you always do! That batlle would’ve been a lot harder without you.” Mercedes sighed wearily and nodded her head. She believed what Annette was saying but she still felt like she could have somehow prevented the professor's collapse. Perhaps she was overthinking things, but the idea troubled her none the less. She decided to quietly focus on making sure she did her best to make the professor's day easier. If she focused, she could learn to improve her magic and stop this from happening again.

After making sure her friend wasn’t too melancholy, Annette began her own preparations for the day. Honestly, she was just as concerned for the professor as Mercedes. Seeing her usually steadfast and stoic professor collapse after a battle surprised her greatly. Annette figured he would be strong enough to keep teaching however, and planned accordingly.

Delicately, Annette lifted up a neatly wrapped treat buried among her usual stuff. Originally she had planned to work overnight with Mercedes to bake a larger batch of sweets for the professor. But it was obvious that her friend wasn’t up for it, so she had to settle for purchasing one early in the morning from a merchant who was settling in town. It was only one, relatively fresh treat, but Annette knew from experience that sweets always made people feel better.

As his students went about getting ready for the lectures, waiting for the professor that was already present, Byleth stood awkwardly on the table. He hadn't motioned towards any of his students, and he was too curious to hear what they were saying to call out to them. He had completely missed his chance to get all their attentions before they distracted themselves.

“Well this is going well.” Sothis noted sarcastically. “You have everyone’s full attention.”

“I could do without your commentary, thank you very much.” Byleth replied, not in his usual stoic mood. “I just have to wait for someone to come to my desk. I’m certain someone will come by to see if I have anything set up.”

“And then they’ll see an insect on their precious professor’s table, and crush it with the slightest bit of effort. My powers will be able to restore you, but that what stop their hand from falling once again.”

“I doubt that will be an issue. I am not so small that I am beyond recognition. …At least I think I that's the case.” Sothis scoffed at Byleth’s plan, but decided against protesting any further. No matter what she desired, it's not like they had any choice otherwise. For now Sothis just needed to fend off the nagging sensation of sleep. She had to be alert if/when her vessel ended up a stain on a palm. Byleth himself had to be ready for whatever was going to come his way, things could still get stranger, worse, or both.

After some time...

1) Annette drops off her sweet and recognizes Byleth, telling the other Lions about him.

2) Ingrid, frustrated and irritated by Sylvain, comes to Byleth’s desk and sees him… as a pest.

3) Flayn appears, pretending to be Byleth’s chaperone so she can finally become one of the students.
1122.title: The Smallest of the Pride

11223.content:
The chatter was interrupted by a polite knock on the door, causing the Lions to turn and Byleth to look up, seeing Flayn standing in the doorway looking nervous.

"Hello everyone " she greets timidly "I am here because I was chosen as Professor Byleths chaperone until the current issues have been dealt with" she explains "because where he goes I go, I'll be joining this class" she ends with a smile

"That's all well and good, but you're not a very good chaperone if your person isn't with you " Felix notes, making Flayn pout before walking to the desk

"Jeralt said he was dropping him off...ah there you are" she says mostly to herself, placing her palm up hand on the desk, the message obvious

"You know, you could have just asked to join the class" he says seeing through the green haired girl's deception, as seen by her blush

"Well yes but fa...big brother would have said no. Anyway, ready to greet the class Professor?" Byleth nods and so she turns to face the others, the shrunken man sitting in her palms "as you can see, the professor's condition is a little complicated"

"Incredible"
"Oh my!"
"Damn, the Professor is so small, imagine what one of the girls could with to him at that size" Sylvain leers, until Ingrid smacks him in the back of the head

"The Professor has more important things on his mind than women's assets" she sneers

'The pervert is right though, at your current size there are a lot of things that can be done with you, especially when you're smaller than all the boobs in the monastery, be it the staff, the other students, Hell little miss cutie even has boobs bigger than you' Sothis giggling as she helpfully points this out to Byleth, who turns his head and swallows thickly: despite the modest clothing there were still noticable bumps on Flayns chest, bumps bigger than the Professor in her hands right now.

Coughing to regain focus Byleth speaks to his students "as you can see, there are a LOT of things I'm unable to do, but Lady Rhea has allowed me to continue to teach you, provided I don't over exert myself, probably the other reason for a helper, besides getting me from one place to another. Unless relevant please continue to act as if nothing is wrong, I have no pain or discomfort, besides getting used to how big everything and everyone is, I'm perfectly ok, just small" he explains to nods of understanding "with that out of the way, if anyone needs me I'll be on Flayns desk" he smiles at the young woman who grins and finds a seat, gently placing Byleth in front of her and beginning to work.

What next?

1) Having seen how upset Mercedes was, Byleth invites her for tea and a chat
2) Rhea arrives at the classroom to announce Byleths chaperone, surprised to see Flayn there.
3) Flayn brings Blyth to her room after class wanting to spend time and thank her new Professor for letting her join his class
11223.title: The New Student: Flayn

12.content: The Black Eagle House serves students from the Adrestian Empire and is run by house leader Edelgard von Hresvelg. The house features mostly mages of noble birth
12.title: The Black Eagles

121.content: Edelgard in the princess to the Adrestian Empire. To even her close allies, she comes off as detached yet determined to reach her goals. She wants to lead her empire to a new and brighter dawn. However, a change size might make it difficult.
121.title: Edelgard: The Imperial Princess

1211.content:
[Pre-time skip, nothing spoilery in this chapter]

"So you were given these by a strange red haired woman in the market?" Edelgard looks a nervously twitching Bernadette in the eye as she holds up a rack of crystal vials containing a deep purple liquid

"Sshe was a merchant, I bought them from her when she said they'd grant my u-u-u-ltimate desire" the archer stutters, the future Empress's laser focus on her not helping her usual anxiety in fact making it worse.

"Your ultimate desire yes?" Edelgard hums, switching gaze from the noble to the vials, to Berni's relief, the girl nearly collapsing where she currently stands "These will be of valuable use to the Black Eagles, I'll keep them in my room and we can show them to the professor after our next class" she states, turning her head so the younger girl doesn't see her blush, in turn not seeing Bernadette's pink cheeks as link most of the other women in the monastery there was some level of infatuation towards the newest professor Byleth, who seemed to see through all their defences with a single glance of his eyes

"Y-you're right Edelgard, best you bring it to the professor" Berni nods, tapping her fingers together "Do you know what it will grant you?"

Edelgard smirks "I think I do, but we'll find out by the end of the week" the archer nods, leaving the other girl to hide in her room,

That evening Edelgard sat on her bed, her mind drifting to the vials Bernadette was given, as well as the desire it would grant them all, she would be able to stop Rhea and free them from Seiro's grasp, she just had to take the chance. Skipping the plan of checking with the professor she pops open one of the vials and downs it, the liquid watery and sweet. and she smiles, before her head throbs and she passes out onto the bed.

Groaning Edelgard awakens the next morning to see things were very wrong indeed: she was sitting on her bed, but the entire room was huge... no she was little, maybe about 3-4 inches tall. How was this her ultimate desire?

What the royal didn't know was Anna didn't give Bernadette vials that grant desires, but that grant HER greatest desire, to be unnoticed and able to remain hidden, in this case through shrinking. Details are important with things like this.

Edelgard tried focus her mind, trying to figure out how to deal with this, when her door opens.

Who was it?

Byleth, checking up on his favourite students?
Bernadette, making sure the plan was still going on?
Someone else?
1211.title: Misleading descriptions

choices: Bernadetta agrees to help Edelgard, taking her to get help.
Bernadetta agrees to help... As long as it doesn't involve anyone else knowing.
Bernie's lost in her imagination. She retreats to her room to hide forever.
12112.content:
“Um, Edelgard, you in here?” Despite Bernadetta’s usual soft-spoken nature, her voice was booming. “We’re still on to see Professor Byleth, right?” She stepped into the room, scanning it for any sign of her house leader. It was empty. “Huh, strange… She’s not here.”

Edelgard stood up, rushing towards the edge of the bed. “Bernadetta! Down here!”

The purple haired girl’s head whipped to the source fo the noise. She found herself looking at the unkempt bed. It was unlike Edelgard to neglect something as simple as making her bed. Looking closer, she could have sworn she saw something moving.

“Bernadetta!”

“EEP! What was that!?” She yelped, jumping in the air.

“Down here! On the bed!”

Bernadetta finally looked down, her eyes going wide in shock. “Whaaa! Ed-Edelgard!?”

“N-not so loud!”

“S-SORRY!” She cried, dropping down to her knees to get a better look at the tiny princess. “What happened?”

Edelgard sighed, realizing she’d have to explain her overzealous, yet foolish actions. “I got impatient and tested the potion.” She looked away from sergeant classmate’s eyes and stared at the sheets below her.

“The potion I brought you?” Bernadetta asked, slowly piecing together the information. “Oh no. Oh no no no. This is all my fault. Oh, Goddess, I’m the reason why you’re tiny. If anyone finds out, I’m dead. This is an international incident at minimum. I can’t go on the run. I don’t even like leaving my room!”

“Bernadetta, calm yourself!” Edelgard snapped. “You’re from the Empire. At most it will be contained in the Empire.”

The shy girl yelped. “That’s even worse! I can’t even take asylum in Faerghus or the Alliance! No one can ever find out about this!”

Before Edelgard could retort, Bernadetta snatched Edelgard up in her hand, closing it around her waist and torso. The tiny princess struggled, trying to break free. However, Bernadetta’s fingers kept her in an iron vice, refusing to let go as if her life depended on it.

“I… I can overlook this!” Edelgard promised, trying to assure Bernie and cut off her wild imagination before it got any worse. “I can, um, pardon you. Especially if you vow to do everything in your power to help me back to normal size.”
12112.title: Puny Princess, Big Bernie

choices: Bernie finds an empty jar on her desk. Edelgard is trapped inside.
Bernie places Edelgard on a high shelf. Edelgard figures out an escape plan.
Bernie can't find anything suitable and, in desperation, uses one of her boots.
121123.content:
A gavel banged with the sound of a dropped anvil. “Bernadetta von Varley! You stand accused of shrinking the princess! How do you plead?”

The purple-haired girl felt a thousand demonic eyes peering into her very soul as the entire courthouse turned to face her. She barely stammered a single word. “I- Wh- E- I-”

“That’s her, everyone!” Hubert stood up from the bleachers. “That’s the one who hurt my dear perfect Lady Edelgard!”

Lady Rhea rose beside them. “This one is unclean and impure and must be purged from the face of this earth for their sinful existence!”

Professor Byleth also took a stand. “And they missed last week’s homework!”

The entire courthouse gasped in collective shock and disgust. Bernadetta squealed in red-hot embarrassment and fright - and then screamed as she realized that she was only in her underwear.

The judge pointed at the guilty party. “Bernadetta von Varley! We sentence you to the worst punishment imaginable!”

Bernadetta squirmed as she felt her life crumbling around her. Was she being locked in the darkest dingiest dungeon there was? Was it straight to the gallows to chop off her head?!

“One bajillion years of working as a chef in a talkative cafe!”

The gavel banged to punctuate its sentence as Bernadetta fell to her knees, cursing the heavens themselves.

“NOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO-”

*

“-Bernie? Bernadetta? Can you hear me?”

Bernie returned to reality and looked at the tiny princess in her hands.

“Good. Please don’t space out like that again, you had me concerned. I just need you to take me to Professor Byleth and-”

Bernadetta silenced the miniaturized regent as she cupped both of her hands together, locking Edelgard between her sweaty palms, and ran out of the room as fast as her wobbly knees could carry her. She didn’t stop for anything as she made a beeline through the student accommodations. Unfortunately for the princess now being jostled around in her ‘cage’, none of the passerbys sought to question Bernadetta fleeing in terror back to her room, which was 'just a Bernie thing' by now. Edelgard cursed under her breath as she was ricocheted with each frantic step Bernadetta took. This was going to be more problematic than she had hoped.

Bernie slammed the door shut behind her as she found herself back in her home away from home. There was no prying eyes or loud voices in her room - just peaceful solitude and not a care in the world. Except that now she had the heir to the Empire in the palm of her hands, of course.

Babbling with panic, the purple-haired girl whipped her head around, trying to find someplace to store Edelgard - Bernie knew that the miniaturized princess wouldn’t want to live in her room forever.

Bernie squealed with fright as she felt Edelgard kicking inside her cupped hands in protest. There had to be somewhere to put her...!
121123.title: The Worst Sentence Imaginable

choices: Feeding time comes, and Edelgard launches another escape plan.
1211231.content:
(Then you better let her out!)

Bernadetta rummaged through her room, looking for something to contain the tiny princess. Finally, she managed to dig out a jar that she normally used for water when she woke up in the middle of the night. It would have to do, and it was only a small price to pay to keep her secret crime hidden from the rest of the world.

“Bernadetta,” Edelgard began, noticing the jar in the larger girl’s hands. “You can’t seriously—”

Before Edelgard could even finish, Bernie scooped her up and dumped her into the glass prison. “Sorry, Edelgard!” She squeaked, setting the jar back onto her desk. Grabbing the lid, she quickly sealed it tight.

The shrunken princess began to swipe at the walls, finding the thick glass to be too much to even put a dent in. Her pounding landed with a dull thud, and she was beginning to know what if felt like for a bandit to try to pierce her armor.

Her eyes went wide as she realized that Bernadetta was tightening the lid, effectively cutting off her air supply. She kept calm, knowing that her classmate couldn’t be this careless. Though, she did have a plan in mind to get out.

Edelgard dropped to her knees and clutched her neck, pretending to suffocate. She needed to make a show of it to prove to her captor just how horrendously stupid this idea was.

“Oh, Goddess, you need to breathe!” she yelped. Thinking quickly, she rushed over to her quiver and grabbing an arrow. Now without thinking, she slammed it down on the lid, piercing a hole at the top…

And nearly inches away from impaling Edelgard. The tiny princess managed to drop down and against the wall, knowing how south this could quickly go.

“EEEP! I’M SO SORRY!”

Edelgard stood back up and began to throw obscenities in her giant warden’s direction. Most of it directed at just how careless she was, especially with the Imperial Princess’ life in her hands. Her voice was completely muffled by the relative inches of wall ahead of her.

If Bernadetta had heard the princess’ threats, she would have resolved to never to let Edelgard out. Though from the looks of how animated and livid she looked, Bernadetta got the point.

“C-calm down, please…” Bernadetta begged, dropping to her knees to meet the tiny princess eye to eye. “It’s not so bad in here. I promise to feed you everyday!”

Another wave of protests came, this time inspired by the fact that she was being treated like a pet now, which was no way to treat the future Emperor.
1211231.title: Do You Have Princess Edelgard in a Jar?

choices: The jar stays intact. Edelgard rolls away in it to flee before Bernie returns.
The jar breaks. Edelgard is fine, but Bernie returns before she can escape.
The jar breaks. Edelgard winds up injured as a result.
12112311.content:
(Mild spoilers for Edelgard's backstory / C Support conversation with Byleth.)

*


Bernadetta watched the furious princess banging at the walls of their glass prison. Bernie earnestly wished that the two could trade places, envying the utter safety and solitude the jar must grant, but alas, she didn't think Edelgard was nearly as appreciative of their new home.

"D-Don't worry! I'll... I'll go get you some food! I bet you'll feel better on a full stomach, right? No need to have me killed when you've had a nice meal, right?!" Bernadetta gave a laugh that was more than a bit hysterical as she slowly backed away from the jar, as if she figured it might explode into broken shards and royal rage at any moment. When it seemed evident enough that Edelgard's tiny form couldn't break the glass, Bernadetta whimpered and quickly fled her room, fleeing to the greenhouse to poach what stray seeds and vegetables that she could find. She was in such a hurry that she even left the door slightly ajar (which only served to taunt her prisoner further.)

Edelgard was left alone, gritting her teeth with frustration as her fists began to ache with each pound on the glass. She knew that Bernadetta could be irrational at times, but this was simply unbearable. How was she going to return to her duties and her ambitions when she was merely an ornament on a shelf? She had no doubt that Hubert would be persistent enough to search the whole of the monastery grounds for his missing lady once he discovered her disappearance, but there was no telling when that could be. Besides, there was a good chance he might have Bernadetta assassinated for her actions, and while Edelgard had more than a few choice words to share with the archer, she'd prefer to avoid such an incident.

The shrunken princess peered around the room, searching for anything that might assist her in an escape before Bernadetta returned. The girl's room had several items of interest, from the stuffed animals huddled together on the bed to the mountain of borrowed books leering on the high shelf nearby. The surface of the desk even housed a few leftover snacks, some writing implements and Bernadetta's bow. However, everything was inevitably out of her reach.

Edelgard clenched her fists tight, the fingers sinking into the skin. To be trapped like a rat, away from the sun, powerless... She had promised herself that she would never feel like this again.

In desperation, Edelgard eyed the edge of the desk. It wasn't too far from where Bernadetta had placed the jar - just far enough that, if Edelgard stood on the tips of her toes and pressed up against the glass, she could barely peer over the edge. It was a nauseating distance to the floor below, but perhaps...

It was a slim chance at escape or who knows how long as a pet. Edelgard made her choice, taking what few steps back that she could in her confined space. She steeled herself and then ran forward, tackling the jar's front wall with her right shoulder. A throbbing pain bled through her arm on impact, but her plan was working - the jar had inched ever-so-slightly forward with the force of her slam. It would take several more, but she could make it to the edge. The princess repeated her attack on the glass, over and over. Each tackle inched her closer to victory, but in turn, the pain in her arm rose each time. Soon enough, her right arm seemed fit to snap, yet she wouldn't relent as she switched to the left and continued her assault.

Eventually, even as both of her arms were numb and aching, the jar teetered on the edge of the desk. The princess took a deep breath, and with a battle cry, she launched herself at the wall one more time. Gravity took hold as the jar fell overboard to the floor below, with its prisoner plummeting along with it...
12112311.title: I'll See Myself Out

choices: Bernadetta manages to catch Edelgard, hiding her away before the others see her.
Dorothea and Petra catch Edelgard first, discovering their tiny house leader.
Edelgard hides from her pursuers and escapes the jar, planning her next move.
121123111.content:
Edelgard screamed, bracing herself as best she could as the jar collided with the floor below. It bounced a few times on the hard stone, severely rattling the tiny empress but thankfully not injuring her, before finally rolling to a stop halfway between the shelf and the open door.

"Ugh..." Edelgard moaned, recovering from the dizziness as she took stock of her new situation. "Why didn't the jar break? Oh well, that's probably for the best. Now, to escape before Bernadetta comes back. How do I..."

She pushed experimentally on the side of the jar. To her delight, she was strong enough to move it, though doing so quickly caused her to stumble again. Thinking of how best to move consistently, she sighed in embarrassment as only one idea came to her.

"I hope no one sees me like this..."

---

Bernadetta was leaving the dining hall with her arms full of food that she remembered Edelgard liking- hopefully the princess would be touched enough that Bernadetta remembered her favorite meal that she wouldn't throw her in prison for shrinking and nearly suffocating her.

"Oh, hey, it's Bernie!"

Bernadetta gasped, freezing in place and dropping her food as a smiling Dorothea and Petra approached her.

Don't run! Bernadetta screamed mentally. If you run, they'll chase you! And they'll find Edelgard and she'll tell them what you did and then you'll die, Bernie! You'll die!

"Um... hello..." Bernadetta greeted the two nervously. She was doing her best not to hyperventilate. She wasn't succeeding.

"It is rare to see you out of your room," said Petra, already kneeling to help Bernadetta gather the food she dropped. "Usually you are hidden away like a bear that hibernates. But less hair-ful and growling, and more squeaking, like a creature a bear would eat."

Please stop comparing me to prey every time you talk to me, Bernadetta tried to plead with the foreign princess. What came out instead was a pathetic squeak.

"Yes! Like that!" Petra thrust the now somewhat crushed meal into Bernie's hands. "Here. It should still be good. It is the rule of five seconds."

"There's a market stall in town with imported goods from Brigid," Dorothea announced excitedly. "Petra and I were going to look for you and Edelgard before we left and try to make it a girls' day out. Have you seen her?"

"I'M NOT KEEPING EDELGARD HOSTAGE IN MY ROOM!" Bernadetta shouted in a panic. Fortunately for the nervous archer, that outburst would have been in character whether Edelgard was captive in her room or not, so the pair didn't find it suspicious. Unfortunately, it further convinced Dorothea that her shy friend needed some positive human interaction, meaning they wouldn't leave Bernadetta alone anytime soon.

"We know that," Dorothea assured her gently. Bernie flinched as she put an arm on her shoulder. "We were just hoping to spend time with you and her today. As busy as we've been with classes and missions, we don't spend enough time just having fun together. Come on, let's find Edie and go to the market."

As Bernadetta looked around the courtyard nervously and tried to come up with an excuse not to go, her eyes settled on the door to her room.

Oh no, I left it open!

Spotting some movement, Bernadetta looked to the ground, and shrieked in horror upon seeing Edelgard, scampering on all fours like a mouse as she rolled the jar out of her room.

"EDELGARD, NO!" Bernadetta dropped the food. "IT'S NOT SAFE!"

"Edelgard?" Dorothea frowned in confusion. "What's not safe?"

Petra squinted as she followed Bernadetta's gaze. "A tiny thing is leaving Bernie's room!"

Oh goddess oh no think Bernie think...

"My hamster's escaping!" Bernadetta quickly lied. "I-I named it after Edelgard! Please don't tell her! Or anyone!"

Good job, Bernie!

Thanks, Other Bernie!

"Aw, that's adorable!" Dorothea cooed. "Quick, let's catch the poor thing before it gets hurt!"

"NO YOU'LL SCARE IT!" Bernadetta yelled as she took off after the shrunken princess. Petra and Dorothea ignored her and joined the chase, determined to help keep what they thought was Bernadetta's secret little pet safe.

---

I'll lose Bernadetta, then head somewhere safe and escape, Edelgard decided. Then I'll find Professor Byleth or someone else to help me get back to normal size.

121123113.content:
The glass jar easily broke against the hardwood floor, sending shattered pieces of glass everywhere. The fall had left Edelgard both breathless and absolutely defenseless to the rain of shards. A searing pain shot in her shoulder, and she had let out another cry, this one motivated entirely by pain. She glanced at her side, finding a crystal lance embedded into her chest. Had it gone a bit more to the right, it would have easily pierced her heart.

Still preferable to returning to captivity, she thought grimly. Forcing herself to sit up, the injured princess debated on whether or not to remove the shard from her shoulder. Eventually, she wrapped her hand around it and tried to pull, letting out another cry to vent the pain. The lance didn’t budge.

Edelgard sighed, resolving to just keep it in place. All she had to do was find someone, and surely they’d help her get medical attention. Fueled by a combination of determination and adrenaline, Edelgard made her way towards the open door. Freedom was in sight.

Every step filled her with pain. As it turned out, the glass had did a number on her, nearly shredding her into pieces. Cuts tore through her legs, ruining her red leggings. However, that was the least of her issues as it felt like she was being stabbed with each movement. That didn’t matter. She needed out now.

Eventually, she got through the door and into the open air. Bernie’s room had the oppressive scent of… well, Bernie. It was uncomfortably stuffy in there, and the jar only seemed to make it worse. Edelgard was just glad to be closer to freedom.

Unfortunately, it seemed that the adrenaline was wearing out, and the pain only got worse by the moment. She was limping, cradling her arm, and looking like a wounded animal. Blood leaked from her wounds, no doubt contributing to her lightheadedness.

She pushed forwards, heading straight towards a pair of stationary boots nearby. It pained her so much to even move that she couldn’t crane her neck up high enough to get a better look at her potential savior. As long as it wasn’t Bernadetta, she didn’t care.

“Edelgard!?”

Collapsing onto the the ground, the shrunken princess blacked out on the tip of the boot. When Edelgard regained consciousness, she found herself...

Unfortunately for the tiny would be ruler, Bernie had not begun to make her way to someone who could turn her back to normal. Instead she slipped off one of her boots and held the tiny girl over the hole. Edelgard could feel the warm air coming from inside and began to squirm in reaction to it.

123.title: Ferdinand

1231.content:
"Ah, there you are Edelgard!" Ferdinand said, speaking so loud he was almost shouting as usual. Edelgard mentally congratulated herself for picking such a secluded meeting location. No one would hear him from their position in the woods.

"Hello Ferdinand. Glad you could make it." Edelgard said cooly.

"And I'm glad you finally decided to take me up on my challenge! After all the training I've done with the professor, I'm sure I'll easily be able to best you in our sparring match!" Ferdinand replied, taking a few steps away from Edelgard to get into a starting position.

Ferdinand turned back towards Edelgard just in time to see her snap her fingers at him, prompting a bright flash from her hand that blinded and engulfed him. When his vision returned, he was no longer looking at Edelgard's face. Instead, he was looking at her now giant boots. When he followed them up her legs, he saw that his empress was now towering over him, seeming to be at least 100x taller than him.

"What's going on Edelgard? Why am I so small?" Ferdinand demanded, looking up at the towering white haired girl.

"I shrunk you Ferdinand." Edelgard said matter-of-factly. "I should think that was obvious. The Professor has been helping me focus on Reason Magic recently, and I think it's really paying off."

"But why?"

"It's simple Ferdinand. You are constantly insisting that we are rivals and that you're my superior, and I've been telling you that that couldn't be further from the truth. But you never seem to get the message through your thick skull. So I decided the best thing to do was to make our sizes reflect the way I see you: as a sniveling insect who ought to be groveling at his emperor's feet." Edelgard explained, before stepping out of her boots and dropping her bare feet down on either side of the shrunken redhead.

"I thought we were coming out here to spar?" Ferdinand said weakly, having trouble accepting the sudden change of scenario.

"Ah yes Ferdinand. You'll still get your fight. I want to see how you fare against my feet."

Ferdinand was unprepared by how fast she spring into action. All of a sudden, she jumped backwards, putting some space between the two of them, only for her right foot to then come swinging forwards like a pendulum. It caught him between her toes, squeezing him as it lifted him up off the ground into the air. Then she released at the top of her swing, and he was airborne.

Ferdinand had never liked heights. Caspar had occasionally tried to talk him into trying wyvern riding, but he always made an excuse to avoid it. Now he wished he had a wyvern below him, rather than the spastic flight he was currently engaged in. When he finally felt himself starting to descend, he looked down towards the ground, wanting to see what surface he would be splattering against. What he saw instead was the sole of Edelgard's pale white foot, upturned and held precisely under him. She had kicked him up and over her head, and now was going to catch him behind her back with her foot. He landed hard on her sole, face smearing against the somewhat sweaty surface. Foolishly, he thought it was over. With a flick of her ankle, he was airborne again, flying up and over her head once more, towards another awaiting foot. This continued for some time, with Ferdinand getting more and more disoriented with every kick. He tried to catch a glimpse of her face when he flew past it, wanting to see what she was thinking and why she was doing this. He expected her to look angry at him, or maybe like she was having fun, but instead she looked... disinterested? It was like this was an everyday thing for her. Sometimes she smiled after a particularly tricky kick, but overall she seemed rather unimpressed by her torture method. Finally, out of what Ferdinand suspected was boredom, she allowed him to drop to the ground in front of her, leaving him panting on his hands and knees before his empress.

Edelgard had never had much respect for Ferdinand, but she felt what little she had slipping away with each impact with her feet. He wasn't her rival, he was simply hers. A possession to do whatever she desired with, whose only purpose in life was to ease the burden of her governance. His life was hers to use, and dispose of, at a twitch of her ankle.

Ferdinand felt this change in roles too. He could tell by how she looked at him that she didn't consider him anything more than a temporary distraction that happened to be rather fun to toy with beneath her toes. He always knew in his heart that she took their rivalry less seriously than he did, but to realize that he didn't even register on her radar as anything other than a nuisance. Filled with rage at the realization of how little he mattered to her, he drew his axe.

"HYAHHH!" Ferdinand yelled, bringing his axe down on the empress's big toe. The front edge of it struck the skin of her toe, making a small cut before the axe was stopped by her nail. The middle of the axe struck the hard surface and stuck in place, leaving him unable to remove the weapon.

Edelgard was furious: "Did you just strike your empress?" She dislodged his axe with an effortlessly flick of her ankle, sending it spiraling away, before abruptly slamming her foot down on top of the shrunken man.

Ferdinand had all the air forced from his lungs as her now increasingly dirt covered foot stomped down on him. His surprise at her speed was quickly replaced by surprise that he had survived the strike, knowing a regular bug would have been obliterated by the impact. The ball of her foot came down right on his ribcage, leaving him with his face pinned beneath her big toe. The underside of it was covered in dirt from being barefoot, but that didn't stop her from grinding it on Ferdinand's face, pushing the back of his head deeper into the dirt as she gradually increased the pressure. Just when he thought she wouldn't stop until his head cracked like a coconut, she lifted her foot off of him. He gasped down air desperately, relieved to be able to breathe.

She didn't move her foot to the side though. She lifted it straight up into the air, allowing it to hang above him like the blade of a guillotine. And before he could get to his feet, she brought it down on him once more. She stomped him over and over again, driving him into the dirt, squeezing out a little bit of her rage at his rebellion with each stomp.

"I'd like to spend all day stomping you bug, but as empress, I have responsibilities." Edelgard said, smirking at the sight of the tiny man laying in her footprint in the dirt.

"Does this mean you'll grow me back?" Ferdinand asked weakly, every ounce of energy extracted from him by the pale feet of his empress.

"Well Ferdinand, do you still think you're my equal?" Edelgard asked.

"No, no, of course not. I'm nothing compared to you." Ferdinand groveled, desperate not to make her angrier after his axe stunt. He couldn't take any more.

"Well then, I don't see why you should be the same size as me." Edelgard replied. "Don't worry, I know you feel very strongly about your duty as a noble, so I'll make sure you still get to support me, in your little insect way." Rather than wait for him to ask what she meant, the silver haired empress grabbed her shrunken classmate between her toes, pinching him tightly and lifting him up over the entrance to her boot. She separated her toes without warning, allowing him to plummet down into the darkness of her shoe.

Ferdinand landed hard on Edelgard's insole and immediately found himself surrounded by the familiar smell of Edelgard's feet. He looked up at his empress through the hole he'd fallen into, seeing her giant purple eyes trained on him.

"I'm thinking you'll make a good insole. My feet can get very sore after a long day of training, so I'll take any cushioning I can get. Even if it comes from a worthless speck like you." Edlegard said, before rising to her full height. Once again, her face was miles above him, and he doubted she could even see him in the dark confines of her shoe. "You'd better run to the toe section unless you want to be flattened." Edelgard warned. This wasn't out of anything resembling sympathy, she merely wanted to ensure that her foot toy stuck around for a while.

Ferdinand got the message when he saw her foot lift over the shoe's entrance, encasing him in its shadow. He began a mad sprint into the boot's depths, as though there were some exit he could find if he only ran far enough. Of course, no such exit existed. The light in the boot was snuffed out as Edelgard's foot entered, blocking the only entrance. He could see only a faint outline of her toes as they came barreling into him, carrying him the rest of the way into the boot. When they arrived together at the toe of the boot, her foot settled in on top of him. His chest was beneath the ball of her foot once more, but this time his head was between her big and second toes, allowing them to secure his new position in life with a taunting squeeze. And then, without another word from her, she began to walk.

Edelgard smiled as she strode back towards the monastery, feeling Ferdinand squirm against her every step and knowing that he was beginning to understand his place in her world. As she walked, her mind was full of ideas about how she should punish him further. Perhaps a combat training session with Petra while Ferdinand struggled in her boot would have the desired effect? Or maybe she should find someone to share him with? Dorothea had always seemed to hate him. She didn't know why, but that didn't matter. It would be enough to motivate her to join in the fun. Her last idea was perhaps her most devious. She could show him how insignificant he was by letting him be killed by a classmate unaware. She imagined slipping him into some sweets for Bernadetta's birthday today, and letting the timid girl devour him. No matter what she picked, she knew her little rival problem was solved.

What if the professor makes me go into class like this? What if she makes me train like this? What if she’s just so mad that she crushes me in her hand? What if she makes me talk to Hubert?

Though, if there was one thing she truly latched onto, it was their number one rule:

Never talk to humans.

The thought of life as a borrower managed to calm her down. All she had to do was escape the professor’s sights for now, and she would be free to live her new life. It would be easy. Her neighbors in her dorm building seemed like all she needed to survive and even thrive.
