15513.title: Someone Else

155132.content:
(Apologies in advance for any spoilers that may appear)

Ignatz's body practically turned to stone when he saw who Byleth's guest was. He'd recognize that snow white hair and those violet orbs anywhere. It was none other than the missing female member of their house, Lysithea. This was the worst outcome the golden deer could have asked for. Even though she tried to hide it, it was no secret the young mage had a sweet tooth. If professor Byleth had invited her for tea time then that only spelt disaster for them.

"This..." Ignatz gulped. "...This is-"

"Well whaddaya know? Looks like Lysithea finally the tallest student in the Golden Deer house." Raphael half joked. It was more the truth than an actual jest. They'd all shrunk so by default she was the tallest. Although his little observation did little to calm down his partner.

Lysithea eyed the spread with a smile adorning her face, the smell of her favorite tea reaching her nose... Honeyed-Fruit Blend. No other tea compared. Then there was the mouth watering sight of sweets. Outside of the professor she hadn't told anyone else about her sweet tooth. Oh how she loved when professor Byleth would pull her aside like this. Sure she did this sort of thing with all the students, but with her it always seemed like she did just that little bit extra. She couldn't wait to sink her teeth into those scones!

The look in those eyes made the rest of the near microscopic Golden Deer nervous. They all now knew who was joining their professor for tea. This wouldn't bode well for any of them. They needed to figure all this out and get off this tea table yesterday. If they didn't... no one would ever find them.

"Marianne! I want you to stay close to me, got it?" Leonie ordered/asked.

"Y-yeah." The blunette stuttered,

"Shake a leg you two. If we don't get off this scone soon we're finished!" HIlda barked before carefully scaled down the baked desert. If she were normal sized she wouldn't mind taking a bite herself. Too bad for her, Lysithea beat her to it and snatched a thankfully empty cookie from the table.

The shrunken members of the Golden Deer watched on in both awe and horror as Lysithea's massive jaws crushed the large cookie into paste. They could each make out each and every crunch made.

"THAT WAS GREAT PROFESSOR! YOU'RE COOKIES ARE THE BEST!" Lysithea smiled.

"THANK YOU!" Byleth smiled back. "I JUST DO WHAT I CAN!"
155132.title: UH OH!

1552.content:
Takes place around chapter, 8, but has some spoilers for chapter 11.

"Are you sure this will work Hubert?" Edelgard asked, watching the dark mage prepare his spell.

"Yes of course I'm sure." Hubert said, finishing the magic circle he was drawing on the ground. "Are you sure this is how you wish to end Dimitri's life?"

"Yes, I'm sure. There can be no evidence of what happened to him...." Edelgard said, firming her convictions for the dark deed she was ordering done.

"Wouldn't it be easier to eat him yourself then?" Hubert asked.

"Call me sentimental, but I don't know if I'd be able to do it. Plus knowing the truth about me would probably drive him insane. Better that his friends be the ones to eat him, without knowing the truth." Edelgard said.

"Very well. I'll commence the spell then." Hubert said with a sinister grin. Edelgard smiled, glad her plan was moving ahead nicely. Still, she couldn't help but wonder what the tiny prince would taste like...

-----

Dimitri woke up in an unfamiliar place, laying stop a brown boulder. He pushed himself to his feet, confused, before toppling over again as the boulder he braced his feet on slid away, toppling down across several identical looking boulders. When he used his hands to brace his impact, he found they sunk into the rock, covering his hands in brown goop. Then his nose kicked in, and he realized this was no rock, but a giant chocolate chip.

"What's going on?" a familiar voice called from behind him. He turned to see Ashe, pinned under the chocolate chip that had rolled away from him. Next to him was Dedue, stoic and silent as always, trying to push the offending sweet off of Ashe.

"Seems like we on top of a pile of giant chocolate chips." Sylvain cut in, appearing from Dimitri's left. Felix was right behind him, irritable as always. "Glad you guys are here too. I woke up a few minutes ago and I thought I'd accidentally broken up with a witch again." Sylvain said, rubbing his neck in embarrassment.

"But how is something like this possible?" Ashe asked. "If these are chocolate chips, we must be no more than a centimeter or two tall!"

"Don't worry Ashe, we will figure this out. First, we should check if any others are here. Sylvain, you've had a chance to look around, is it possible the girls are here somewhere?" Dimitri asked.

"Nope, it's just us. I can sense women a mile away." Sylvain said, joking despite the dangerous situation.

As if to prove him wrong, the sky suddenly split open, as though clouds had parted in an instant. The boys looked up through half covered eyes towards the light source, only to find Mercedes staring down at them, her giant face framed by the sides of the bag of chocolate chips they were trapped in.

"I don't think your senses work very well." Felix snarled at Sylvain.

"Mercedes! We are in here!" Dimitri yelled, hoping the giant cleric would hear him.

Unfortunately, she didn't. All she said was "I have a feeling these are going to be my best cookies yet." before tipping the bag to its side and starting a chocolate avalanche. The shrunken boys grasped for a handhold, but everything in the bag was in motion, and before long all of them had fallen out of the bag and into the mixing bowl filled with cookie mix.

The boys lost track of each other as they landed in the mixing bowl. They were each temporarily submerged under the cookie mix, barely able to swim to the surface of the mucky mix. When they did, they were met with a cloud of descending flour as Mercedes dumped the contents of a flour bag down onto them. Coated in flour, the tiny lions were completely unrecognizable, and Mercedes didn't notice them as she lowered a wooden spoon down towards them. Mercedes began the familiar process of stirring the mix, with no regard for the tiny people being stirred with it.

The tiny people could barely breath or see as they spun in dizzy circles. They were struck by the fast moving wooden spoon, slammed against the walls of the bowl, and forced under the thickening mix. As they struggled to remain conscious, the mixing slowed to a stop, leaving them gasping for breath and nearly buried alive in cookie dough. They had no energy left to fight back as Mercedes began to scoop cookie sized globs of dough onto a tray, preparing them for baking. Only when she lifted the tray to bring it towards the waiting oven did the tiny boys begin yelling again, their fear of the oven snapping them out of their spoon induced daze. But Mercedes didn't hear a thing, and just smiled cutely as she slid the tray into the oven and slammed the door, sealing them in hell.

The heat was unbearable. The cookie dough surrounding them insulated them enough to keep them alive, but it was still a living hell.

"So which girl do you want to get eaten by?" Sylvain asked, trying to lighten the mood in the horrendous heat. No one was amused, and Ashe couldn't help but let out a desperate, fearful sob at the thought. "Jeez, tough crowd." Sylvain murmured.

"None of us should be here but you Dimitri! You're the wild boar, you're the one who should be hunted and eaten like the animal you are." Felix scowled, taking his anger out on the future king.

"Give it a rest with the boar crap already Felix! Just shut up and hope you get crushed by a girl's teeth before you're digested!" Dimitri yelled, unable to contain his anger. Ashe sobbed again, but things were silent otherwise after that.

----

The shrunken lions had never been as relieved as they were when they saw Mercedes open the oven. There was the smiling face of their friend and healer, the girl who had saved them from death dozens of times. But now she wasn't smiling at her friends as she healed them, she was smiling at her food as she outstretched and oven mitt towards them. She pulled the tray out of the oven, and 4 tiny sighs of relief were let out as they escaped the hellish heat of the oven.

Mercedes leaned down over the tray and inhaled deeply, loving the smell of her completed work. She happened to be right above Dimitri when she did this, who saw the dark abyss of her nostrils hanging above him. The suction of her breath might have pulled him in if he wasn't trapped in a cookie. Instead, he stayed rooted in place, looking up at her beautiful face as she licked her lips. "Ah the girls are going to just love these cookies! Especially Annette."

Mercedes turned and walked out of their sight, no doubt to go call her friends in. The tiny lions were running out of time.

"What are we going to do? We are dead!" Ashe yelled, panicking.

"Remain calm Ashe. I believe the girls will notice us before we are consumed." Dedue said stoically, somehow always calm. But even he had a hard time staying calm as the girls stampeded in, Mercedes in the lead. 3 giantesses stood eagerly around the round table, watching as Mercedes brandished a spatula above them. Ashe screamed as the spatula came down for him first, slipping underneath the cookie he was trapped in. His screams were pulled away from the rest of the boys as he was deposited down onto Ingrid's plate. The beautiful blonde knight smiled at the sight of her cookie, but didn't grab it yet, waiting patiently for the other girls.

Sylvain was next. He was feeling very conflicted about this. He had no interest in dying, but he couldn't help but hope that if he was going to be eaten, that it was by one of the hotter girls. Ingrid was taken, so Mercedes seemed like a good choice. Unfortunately, Mercedes scooped him into Flayn's plate. Sylvain sighed with disappointment. Sure, Flayn was cute, but she was also younger than Lysithea. At least, that's what he guessed from her appearance. And even if they did get noticed before being eaten, he expected he'd be getting a lecture from Seteth on getting too close to Flayn. It almost made him wish for death.

Mercedes quickly scooped Dedue's cookie onto her own plate, not hearing the young man from Duscur shouting her name as he was raised up and lowered back down. Then she turned her spatula to Dimitri.

Dimitri assumed that Annette would be his executioner, watching as the red head licked her lips in excitement, her eyes fixed on him, or rather, the cookie he was in. She was the only one left without a cookie, so it seemed natural it was hers. However, Mercedes surprised them both by scooping him into a different plate that was sitting in the middle of the table.

"What's the big idea Merci?" Annette asked, dying for a cookie at this point.

"Relax Annette you'll get one." Mercedes said, moving her spatula towards Felix. "It's Edelgard's birthday, so I'm just saving one for her."

Dimitri nearly snapped at the thought. As if being eaten wasn't humiliating enough, it appeared he was destined to end up as a bit of fat on the ass of his greatest rival. Not only that, but he was forced to watch as Felix was deposited on Annette's plate. Once again he was powerless, forced to watch his loved ones die with no way to save them.

What happens?

1. Flayn notices a funny looking chocolate chip, and is shocked to discover it's Sylvain. Felix is already in Annette's mouth though.

2. The girls dig in, and the boys are devoured.

3. Before they can eat, an emergency calls them out of the room, leaving their cookies on the table. But this is just a trick from Lysithea, who comes in and eats them all.
1552.title: Mercedes's Chocolate Chip and Tiny Lion Cookies

choices: Edelgard notices Dimitri. She does what must be done.
Edelgard notices Dimitri. She can't bring herself to harm him.
Edelgard doesn't notice Dimitri. As she lifts the cookie, he falls onto her body
15522.content:
(Spoilers for Edelgard and Dimitri’s past as revealed in Blue Lions route.)

The boys of the Blue Lions remained absolutely helpless as the girls dug into their plates of cookies. Their eyes were focused on the massive lips devouring sweets hundred of times their size. All the while, they were anticipating their demise, fearing the worst as the girls enjoyed their time together.

The first boy to meet misfortune was Ashe, as he felt a considerable amount of air pressure weigh down on him as Ingrid lifted his cookie up to her mouth. Ashe struggled against his sugary binds, finding it impossible to break out. He found himself staring at her awaiting mouth, ones that had excitedly recited tales of valiant knights with him.

At the very least, he would be a bit of nutrition for the blonde knight. It wasn’t much of an honorable death, but he wasn’t all too sure he deserved one in the first place.

He was carried into the dark abyss of Ingrid’s mouth, her hot breath covering everything. Ashe cowered as he passed under her teeth, hoping she wouldn’t bring them on him. Luckily, she didn’t as he was brought to the center of her mouth.

Everything went dark as she bit down, locking him inside and securing his death. The heat began to melt the chocolate chip, turning it into a sludge as it mixed with her saliva. It didn’t take long for the wave of chocolate ooze to roll onto her awaiting tongue, where Ashe was left helpless and left at the mercy of Ingrid’s chewing as a boulder sized crumb came rolling towards him.

“Ashe!” Dimitri cried, barely managing to force an arm out from his prison. He couldn’t do much else but watch in abjection as Ingrid swallowed, a lump sliding down her throat. If he survived the mashing, he would almost certainly die in the pit of the the blonde’s stomach, a fate that made them sick to the core. Though, unlike Ashe, they hadn’t experienced what it truly meant.

Felix would learn next. Annette giddily grabbed cookie in each hand with only one containing the black haired knight. The red haired giantess hummed a song Felix found all too familiar, and if he were honest, charmingly horrific in the moment.

Oh, this mountain of sweets, and treats that I long to eats~

If fate had a sense of humor, it was a dark one, as the lyrics to Annette’s song about food rang through his head. Felix couldn’t help but laugh. It was a fleeting experience that disappeared as he was carelessly tossed into her mouth.

He was deposited into her mouth, landing in a pile of mush. He fought his way up to stand, only to find Annette greedily taking another bite of her cookie, sending a mountain of sweets racing towards him.

Two thoughts rang through his mind, first, he couldn’t help but feel Dimitri was the root of all this somehow. The second was that Annette needed to close her damn mouth when she chewed.

“Felix!” Even if there most recent interactions were mostly hostile, Dimitri was still wounded by the loss of his friend.

Then, Sylvain and Dedue’s cookies were lifted up by Flayn and Mercedes. Both thrashed against their bindings, coming up with nothing as they were being carried into the mouths of the healers. Sylvain was crushed by Flayn’s descending teeth, while Dedue had to watch as Mercedes slowly nibbled at her own cookie.

He was slowly brought over to her awaiting mouth as each bite brought him closer to death. He was caught in the unfortunate position of being directly under her them for her next bite. His weak attempt to shield himself with his hands was useless as he was crushed into paste by the sheer force.

“Dedue…” Dimitri sighed, almost resigned at this point. There was nothing he could do to bring them back. His struggling barely helped. Though at this point, he felt that he could only save himself. After all, he had the most time before his designated executioner devoured him.

“Is Edelgard joining us?”Annette asked, eyeing the last bit of cookies.

Mercedes shook her head. “I was just going to take it to her. I’m sure she’s too busy to stop by.”

—

Seeing the rest of Garreg Mach from his new size was utterly surreal. Everything was just so incomprehensibly huge. And as Mercedes paraded him from the dining hall to the dorm building, he caught other students eying him, looking right past him and focused more on the treats itself.

He continued to struggle against his binds, slowly breaking free. He was getting close. Though, he wasn’t sure what he would do once he was free, his yelling never registered, and he wasn’t really liking the idea of spending the rest of his days like a mite.

With a knock at the door, Mercedes waited for the birthday girl, a warm smile on her lips. Dimitri was unprepared to see the massive form of Edelgard as she answered the door.

“Oh, Mercedes, it’s nice to see you,” she greeted politely. “Is there anything you needed?”

Mercedes shook her head. “Just wanted to give something to the birthday girl on her special day.” She held the plate of cookies forward, pushing it onto her.

Edelgard paled at the implications of the gift and nudged the plate back “Um, my birthday’s under the Garland Moon, but I appreciate the thought.”

Mercedes’ eyes went wide. “Oh, really? Silly me, I always get the dates confused.” She then giggled, not really to upset about her airy nature. “But even still, I prepared these cookies with you in mind. I insist you take them.”

The princess quickly scanned the plate, looking for any hints of Lion in the dish. She could have sworn she saw a royal blue speck moving somewhere on it. “It… does look delicious. However, I have a strict diet to uphold.”

“Nonsense,” Mercedes countered surprisingly firmly. “You train harder than anyone, and I recall you tasking Hubert to swing by the dining hall to pick up cake for you.”

Edelgard forced a chuckle. “You caught me. I guess I can take it.”

“Yay!” the baker cheered. “Just bring the empty dish back to the dining hall when you’re done.”

“Of course,” Edelgard said, her voice stiff. “Thank you.”

As Mercedes turned and walked away, Edelgard brought he tray of cookies into her room and set it on the desk.

Down below, Dimitri had barely broken free from his chocolate prison, and was now rushing towards the edge of the cookie, looking to save himself from the same fate of his fellow students.

All he needed to do was get Edelgard’s attention. Even if they were currently rival house leaders, she was his stepsister, but more importantly an old childhood friend. She even cheered him on after he defeated her at The Battle of Eagle and Lion and set his sights on fighting the Golden Deer. She just had to help him.

Right?
15522.title: Devouring the Blue Lions

choices: Lysithea accidently shrinks what she touches (Side effect)
Lysithea shrinks as a side effect
Professor Byleth shows up and rewinds time
15523.content:
Dimitri shut his eyes in horror and shame at his uselessness. He never wanted to feel like this ever again. But there was nothing he could trapped in this chocolate baked prison. His fate was sealed and so was the fate of his friends. They'd be gobbled up and go right to the girls hips and no one would be the wiser.

Right before the girl the girls could dig in however, a knock was heard at their door. Mercedes was the first to get up and see who it was only to find one of the knights awaiting her. "Hello there. Is there something you needed from us?" she gestured inside to the other female members of the Blue Lions.

"No. I merely stopped by to drop off a message for the Blue Lion house." The knight answered before holding out a sealed letter. This caught the attention of the room as they stood up to get a better look at the letter. This brought a feeling of relief to the shrunken members of the Blue Lion house as it seemed their lives would be spared... At least for now. Ashe being the most grateful.

Mercedes gently took the letter before ripping it open to read it's contents. As her eyes scanned it over Annette, Flayn, and Ingrid leaned over her shoulders. "What does it say?" Flayn asked.

"Looks like the professor's called for a meeting in the classroom." Mercedes answered.

"Really?" Ingrid questioned. "Why not just tell us in person?"

"I'm sure the professor had a good reason. Besides it's not uncommon for the other professors here to communicate via messages." said Annette.

"Alright then. Let's go everyone." Mercedes smiled. "Oh and thank your for the message Mr. knight."

"it's Jon, but your welcome." The knight nodded before he and everyone else left the room.

Back on the table the other members of the Blue Lions sighed. Thank goodness for the professor. Even unaware of their situation, she's still providing them with aid. If the girls were truly gone then they needed to be before they got back. "Can any of you hear me?!" Dimitri shouted,

"Yep!"

"Loud and clear!"

"I hear you!"

"Indeed my friend!"

"Alright. Unintentionally the professor has bought us enough time to escape. We need to find a way out these... chocolate prisons!" Dimitri struggled.

"We're trying but these damn cookies won't break!" Felix growled.

"To think I'd be trapped by comfort food." Sylvain complained.

"Less talk and more struggling!" Ashe said franticly.

"These are indeed sturdy prisons." Dedue struggled. "I still wonder who could have caused this."

"As do we my friend. But we'll never find out if we don't escape first." said Dimitri.

After a minute or two the remaining members of the blue lions turned their heads back to the door as the sound of footsteps drew close. Were the girls back already?! If so they were doomed. The group began to struggle more desperately than ever before. Death by an unaware friend was the very last thing they wanted.

When the door finally cracked open all present eyes widened. It wasn't Mercedes, Annette, Flayn, or Ingrid who returned. It was none other than the snow haired girl of the Golden Deer, Lysithea. What was she doing here? Wait a moment, maybe she could be of assistance if they got her attention.

"Noe that there gone, Mercedes cookies are all mine!"

Hearing that made the Blue Lions' hearts sink and their blood run cold. She was going to eat them! The miniscule members rewed their struggles with vigor they never knew they had as the violet eyed girl drew closer. Too bad it was all in vain as in less than a second, she was staring down at them.

"Lysithea! It's us don't eat the cookies!" Ashe screamed.

"Don't do it!" Sylvain agreed.

Their words didn't seem to reach her as she reached down for Ashe's cookie. Her massive tree trunk like fingers clasped around him and hoisted him up high in the air. "Help me! PLEASE!"

"Ashe!" Dimitri cried as the silver haired boy was casually tossed into the giantess' mouth. All the remaining members felt ill when the giant girl began chewing. Ashe was gone. Chewed into paste by Lysithea enormous teeth. They wanted to cry for the loss of their friend but another horrifying thought crossed their minds. They were next.

"No! Dedue!"

Indeed the man that had been the prince's closet friend throughout the years was next. "Forgive me my friend."

Those were his last words as he was embraced by the hot and moist darkness. This time the tears did flow from the prince's eyes. He was gone. Dedue was gone. The other members could only watch the small lump slide down Lysithea's throat as she turned her sights to the rest of them.

As fate would have it, Felix was next on the chopping block. His eyes widened but he said nothing. After what happened to both Ashe and Dedue, he had long since given up. The darkness embraced him as well.

"How? How can this be?" Dimitri cried. What would Rodrigue think of his failure to protect his son.

"Wow these are so good." Lysithea mused. "I better finish up quick though before everyone else gets back. It was Sylvain's turn and all he could do was beg for mercy. Mercy that would never come as no one could hear it. The last thing he saw were the bone white pillars that were Lysithea's teeth.

Dimitri was the only one left now. At this point he was broken. More people to join the dead and haunt his nightmares. Lysithea licked her lips and didn't waste a second to go straight for him. He didn't bother to fight back or even struggle. What was the point? He closed his eyes... and met the end.

"That was delicious!" The snow haired girl cheered while she rubbed her stomach. I have to remember to ask Mercedes if I can cook with her one of these days."
15523.title: Comfort Food

choices: Hubert reaches Edelgard, and tries to climb to her ear.
Edelgard sees Hubert running towards her, but mistakes him for a bug.
Meanwhile, Lysithea continues to shrink other people unawares.
155231.content:
Lysithea frowned as she surveyed the now empty table. While she remained blissfully unaware of the five lives tragically cut short by her sweet tooth, she was acutely aware that she had just eaten a bunch of cookies that didn't belong to her.

This would not help her convince the rest of the students that she wasn't childish.

"I should probably go," she declared, quickly getting up and running for the door. As soon as she entered the hallway, her escape was cut short as she roughly bumped into a tall, imposing figure, getting knocked to the ground in the process.

"Ah! Sorry!" Lysithea rambled as she got back to her feet. "Those cookies were gone when I got here! You can prove nothing!" Lysithea finally looked up, only to find Hubert glaring down at her menacingly.

She was fairly sure it was his only facial expression.

"Um... my apologies, Hubert. I thought you were one of the Blue Lions."

"You should watch where you are going," he said in a quiet, menacing voice, his glare never wavering.

"Indeed! I should. Once again, my sincerest apologies," Lysithea repeated, bowing for good measure. "Um... I'll be on my way now."

Lysithea went the opposite direction, moving just slow enough to not be running. Paying the young Golden Deer no further mind, Hubert took a peek in the room she'd just vacated. Spotting an empty plate, he crept in, intent to get a closer look and deal with any survivors. Seeing nothing but cookie crumbs, he nodded grimly to himself.

"It is done. I must report to Lady Edelgard."

Briskly yet silently, he made his way to the second floor of the dorms to Edelgard's room. Just as he finished knocking on the door, he had a sudden dizzy spell and blacked out for a few seconds. When he recovered, he found that the door was now hundreds of feet tall.

"What is this? Could the spell have... no... it was flawless..."

The door opened with a loud creak. Hubert found himself faced with two gigantic high-heeled boots that he immediately recognized. After all, the most important person in his life wore them every single day. He craned his neck up to take in the full view of Edelgard. She was impossibly gigantic, her imposing figure looking every bit like the empress that she deserved to be. That she soon would be.

Hubert felt an odd tickle beneath his nose. He felt it, only to discover it was bleeding. That had never happened before.

"That's strange," Edelgard's voice boomed, as powerful as a goddess to his ears. "I thought I heard someone at the door."

Hearing the door creak again as his liege prepared to shut it snapped Hubert out of his stupor. If his spell could go so disastrously as to shrink the one that cast it, Edelgard wasn't safe either. She had to be informed of the situation. He sprinted towards her, making it through the doorway just before she sealed it, then continued to run after her as her gigantic footfalls took her back to her desk.

As he ran across the stone floor towards her, he tried to think of how best to get her attention...
155231.title: White Haired Karma

choices: Lysithea trains with Catherine, shrinking her before Shamir arrives.
Lysithea sends Marianne to Hilda's makeover in her stead, shrinking the mage.
Lost in thought, she bumps into another student (Reader's Choice)
1552312.content:
(Get it? Cause its the same VA for a series which has a size story that I'm totally not ignoring. Aha, ha... ha...)

Edelgard looked around the hall to see if there was anyone there. However, he halfhearted search came up empty as there were no signs that anyone was in the area. She wouldn't be that surprised if Claude had knocked on her door and rushed back into his room just to mildly annoy her.

She tapped her foot idly, the only sign of frustration she let out. That last thing she wanted was to give the prankster the satisfaction. Although he couldn't really see what she did, it was the principle that mattered. Her eyes drifted down as she noticed her subconscious tick before landing on an ant by her feet.

Perhaps I should stop sneaking sweets in my room.

Down below, Hubert was rushing towards the pair of boots that were far larger than the monastery. While mages weren't known for their mobility, he covered a surprising distance in an attempt to reach her before she returned to her room.

"Lady Edelgard!" Hubert called, hoping that she had a superhuman sense of hearing as one of her many talents.

Suddenly, the imperial princess’ gaze turned downed towards him. However, instead of a look of recognition, Edelgard’s lip simply turned into a slight sneer as she leaned her foot back, raising the platform of her boot.

"Ugh, bugs..."

Such a look was enough to crush his spirit entirely. A large part of his life was spent making every living thought about Lady Edelgard’s benefit. Sure, he had often dreamed of making the ultimate sacrifice for the future empress, but he did not expect it under these circumstances.

He stared up in awe at the sight of Edelgard. The princess looked as regal as ever with even her upturned lip having a sense of grace to it. The shrunken mage saved the image in his mind, deciding he would take in the grand sight of the future empress into the afterlife with him. Now that he knew for sure how his life would end, he could only hope that the rest of Fodlan would crumble beneath her feet as he would.

The shadowy heel descended on him, dropping an unfathomable pressure atop him. His attempt to protect himself was null as he was obliterated instantly, becoming a stain on the immaculate boot of Edelgard von Hresvelg.

The princess didn’t even notice the suspicious squelch beneath her sole. She hardly paid the ant a further thought as she spun on the ball of her foot and stepped back into her dorm room, anxiously waiting for Hubert to report back with the results for her plan to dispose of anyone that would step in her way. She would never notice the splotch of blood under her foot as she stepped on the carpet and unknowingly wiped it off.

——

Lysithea had a rather busy day ahead of her. Thankfully, the sugary plate of cookies gave her the energy she needed to get through the day. For some reason, she had a lot of appointments to make, and she had to get it done before dark so she could avoid any chance of running into ghosts.

One of her appointments was sword training with Catherine. At first, she had no idea why she was tasked to study swordplay. But that only lasted briefly before she was awakened to the awesome power of the Levin Sword during a seminar, and now the young mage just had to have one. The only problem was that she needed to learn how to handle a sword in the first place. After badgering the swordmaster, Lysithea finally got a training session from her fellow Crest of Charon bearer. Though she seemed to recall that Shamir would be joining shortly after their training.

Hilda had also bugged her into a makeover session. The white haired mage had already let her know that she wasn’t interested in makeup anymore, but she would at least drop by and say so. Though, she could just get Marianne to go in her stead. Maybe the two could do something about the ever present bags under the white mage’s eyes.

Still thinking about her schedule...
1552312.title: The Execution Empress

choices: Caspar sees none other than a giant Shamir
Caspar sees none other than a giant Petra
15523123.content:
So lost in thought was the white haired mage over her schedule that she failed to notice the person in front of her. Sure enough she managed to knock herself and the unsuspecting student to the ground. A large crash sound could be heard before a stream of whispered curses.

Once she regained her bearings, Lysithea noticed she had bumped into Caspar von Bergliez of the Black Eagle house. From the looks of things it seemed the blue haired boy was transporting some armor somewhere. Most likely the armory unless one of the knights had enlisted him to shine their fancy suits. Too bad her incompetence caused him to drop everything.

"I am so sorry! I didn't even see you walking here!" Lysithea frantically apologized. Caspar finally turned his attention to the violet eyed girl after finally calming down enough to listen. Her hand was outstretched to help him up and being the gentleman he was, he accepted her aid.

"Don't worry. I'm sorry too. I should really pay more attention." Caspar smiled. Truthfully that armor he was carrying was so damn bulky he was surprised he hadn't dropped it or bumped into someone else until now. "Anyway. You look like you're in a rush. Any reason why?"

Lysithea's eyes bulged. "Oh that's right! I'm still busy today! Very, very, busy! Sorry, Caspar, I would help you clean up but I really have to go!"

And so Caspar watched in confusion as the magic prodigy of the Golden Deer sped down the hall. It would've been nice to get some help scooping up this armor, but then again he knew what it was like to be in a rush and not able to stop for anything. "Oh well. Might as get work with this armor."

Piece by piece, Caspar picked up the silver pieces of metal. While doing so he began to feel a bit woozy. He then noticed he was beginning to sweat. That was odd. This task was so minimal that he shouldn't be this tired already. Or if even at all.

Right as he went for another piece of the armor he felt his world spin. All the metal he had collected previously dropped from his hands and his whole world went dark. When he came to he saw the world around him had grown to ridiculous degrees. No. The world hadn't grown, he'd shrunk!

"No way! This is impossible!"

That's when he felt them. Multiple tremors closing in on his position. What was it?! He looked to his right and received his answer. The tremors were the aftermath of footsteps. His face turned pale however when the giant form suddenly stopped in front of him and noticed the armor all spread around. Compared to their boots he was little more than an ant.

"What's all this armor doing here?"

She's on kitchen duty with Raphael and Ignatz. She shrinks them both.
Focus on Catherine as she tries to get someone's attention.
155231233.content:
(Spoilers for Catherine's supports with Lysithea. One of the choices also spoils Cyril's supports with Lysithea.)

Recovering from her accidental run-in with Caspar, Lysithea went about her busy day. After quickly stopping by Hilda's room to apologize for blowing off the makeover session and send her Marianne's way (giving the pinkette a better outlet for her creative energies and the bluette some much needed social interaction), Lysithea made her way to the training yard, where a grinning Catherine was waiting for her.

"Hey, little sis!" the knight greeted cheerfully. Lysithea smiled and blushed. When she and Catherine discovered how much they had in common- having both the same crest and secret pasts neither liked to talk about- Catherine joked that they were like sisters, and Lysithea admitted that she rather liked the idea. Catherine apparently decided to run with it, to the little mage's delight and occasional embarrassment.

"Good afternoon, Catherine," Lysithea nodded. "Thank you for taking the time to train with me today."

"Sure thing," Catherine shrugged, handing Lysithea one of the practice swords that she was carrying. "We knights are always willing to help students when we have time. Fair warning, though, we might need to cut things short if Lady Rhea summons me."

"That's fine," Lysithea agreed. "So where do we start?"

---

"WHO STOLE OUR COOKIES?!" Annette demanded. "I'll KILL them!"

The girls of Blue Lion House had just returned to their common room after being told by a confused Professor Byleth that no, they hadn't been called for a meeting, only to discover that the cookies Mercedes had baked were now gone.

"Whoa, Annette, calm down," Ingrid held her hands out to try and calm the short, temperamental redhead. "They're just cookies."

"No..." Annette corrected with a growl. "They were MERCIE'S cookies. Which makes them the best cookies in the world! This was going to be the highlight of my day!"

"I can always make more, Ann," Mercedes reminded her friend.

"Yes!" Flayn agreed. "And the next batch of cookies can have fish in them as well! That will make them extra delicious!"

"Flayn, we've been over this," Mercedes sighed tiredly. "Fish and chocolate don't go well together."

"Not with that attitude," Flayn countered. Mercedes remained silent, refusing to get drawn into the Fish Cookie argument again.

"I bet it was the boys," Annette concluded. "None of us have seen them all day. They probably stole the cookies, and are hiding somewhere in shame!"

"That seems out of character for them," Ingrid noted. "Felix doesn't even like sweets. And Dimitri, Dedue, and Ashe wouldn't eat someone else's food without permission. Or if they did, they'd at least stick around and apologize for it."

"What about Sylvain?" Annette countered.

"He'd have stayed to hit on us when we came back," Ingrid replied. None of the other girls could fault her logic.

"Then who stole the cookies?!" Annette demanded.

"One of the knights gave us that message that Professor Byleth was looking for us, correct?" Flayn asked Mercedes.

"Jon, yes," Mercedes nodded as she remembered the knight. "Oh! If that message wasn't from the Professor, then whoever told Jon to deliver it must have done so to trick us into leaving the room."

"So they could steal the cookies!" Annette caught up to her friend's line of thought. "Come on, girls! Let's track down that knight!"

"Shouldn't we be worried about the boys?" Ingrid pointed out. "If they aren't gone because of the cookie thing, where are they?"

"Oh, wherever they are I'm sure they're fine," Annette dismissed.

---

Lysithea frowned as her stomach gurgled. Maybe eating a plate full of cookies just before training was a mistake.

"Everything okay, Lysithea?" Catherine asked, noticing that her trainee had stopped her exercises.

"It's fine," Lysithea assured her. "My stomach's just acting strangely."

Catherine frowned. "I know you're a fan of sweets, Lysithea, but if you're going to be doing more physical activity like sword training, you need to have a more balanced diet."

"I-I know," Lysithea stammered, blushing as she avoided eye contact with the knight. "I'm not a child."

"Good!" Catherine grinned brightly. "Then I expect to see you with a great big plate of veggies at dinner tonight."

Lysithea huffed and resumed practicing her sword strikes.

"Your form's still a little off," Catherine said as she approached her. "Here, let me help."

Catherine walked up behind Lysithea, holding the smaller girl close as she corrected her arm placement and posture. Lysithea blushed, embarrassed by the somewhat intimate contact.

"H-how important is form, anyway?" Lysithea asked. "If I'm using a Levin sword, won't I be keeping my enemies at a distance?"

"Well, that's the plan," Catherine admitted. "But anything can happen in battle. If an opponent manages to get close to you, you need to be able to dodge or block their strikes. A proper stance helps with that."

Satisfied with Lysithea's form, Catherine readied her own practice sword. "Now, I'm going to come at you. Focus on evasion and don't worry about counterattacking just yet. We'll get there soon enough."

---

Meanwhile, the Blue Lion girls hadn't had any luck finding Jon the knight. They did, however, find a pile of armor on the floor.

"What's all this armor doing here?" Ingrid wondered, hands on her hips as she frowned disapprovingly at the disorganized mess on the floor.

"It's not Jon's, is it?" Annette asked. "Did our cookie thief get rid of him to tie up loose ends?!"

"Ann, perhaps we should stop at the dining hall and get you a snack," Mercedes offered. "You get loopy when your blood sugar is low."

"It is strange for this armor to be on the floor," Flayn noted. "Was someone supposed to be moving it?"

Meanwhile, unnoticed by the girls, Caspar was frantically waving for their attention from the floor.

"I'll take care of this," Ingrid decided, kneeling down to pick up the armor. "The rest of you get Annette some food and find that knight."

"Ingrid, wait! I'm down here! Oh, SHI-!"

Caspar's profanity was cut short as Ingrid's knee came down on him, crushing him against the stone floor and obliterating him instantly. Unaware of the red stain on her black tights, Ingrid carried the armor off to the knights' quarters while her housemates went off in search of their quarry.

---

Lysithea breathed heavily. As much as Catherine was clearly holding back, the knight still hit hard and fast, and Lysithea had a few bruises to remember her first training session by.

"Here," Catherine said with a smile as she helped the young mage to her feet. "Now that you've survived your first real training session, I've got a surprise for you."

Opening her satchel, she pulled out a sword shaped like a lightning bolt that crackled with electric energy.

"You brought a real Levin sword?!" Lysithea's eyes widened as she grinned excitedly.

"We have to be careful with it," Catherine warned her. "The church doesn't have many of these lying around and they're a pain to repair. But you might as well see it in action to give you something to work towards. Here, watch me."

Focusing, Catherine swiped with the sword. A tiny bolt of lightning zapped a training dummy in the distance.

"It's usually more impressive than that, but my magic's not exactly anything to write home about," Catherine explained. "Yours, on the other hand, might work wonders." She handed the sword to a reverent Lysithea. "Go ahead. Swipe the sword towards the dummy just like I showed you, while channeling your magic through the sword."

Concentrating, Lysithea did as she was told, letting the sword serve as a conduit for her crest-augmented magic as she swung it in the direction of the dummy. To her surprise and delight, a huge lightning bolt obliterated the dummy on the spot.

"I did it! Did you see, Catherine, I..." Lysithea trailed off as she realized her mentor was nowhere to be found. "Catherine? Where'd you go?"

Meanwhile on the ground, Catherine was busy getting her bearings as the world around her suddenly became much bigger. "Lysithea!" She called up to the mage that now towered over her. "Down here!"

"Did Rhea summon her?" Lysithea wondered, not hearing the tiny Catherine's cries for help as she looked around. "I thought she'd at least say goodbye..."

Catherine yelped and rolled to the side, barely dodging as Lysithea's giant boot narrowly missed crushing her.

"Oh well," Lysithea sighed dejectedly, returning the sword to Catherine's satchel, which the knight apparently abandoned in her haste to leave. "I have a lot more things to do today anyway." She had promised to start teaching Cyril how to read, after all. Hopefully, she'd have time to do that before her scheduled kitchen duty

With that, Lysithea left the training grounds for her next task, unaware of the tiny knight that she was abandoning in the yard.
155231233.title: Annette, You're Not You When You're Hungry

Lady Rhea notices Cyril flailing about
1552312331.content:
It was strange being in the Library without the familiar face of Annette or lack there of, buried in a book. This place was her home away from after all. Though Lysithea figured that was probably for the best as the Blue Lions were the last people she wanted to see right now.

Hopefully she'd be able to help Cyril out before the library's regulars made themselves known. Walking towards the back she grinned happily as she spotted a familiar head of messy black hair. It was none other than Cyril, seated at a desk with a book of his choosing laid out.

That was good. That mean she wouldn't have to search high and low for any reading material. The library just had so many options, action, drama, fantasy, romance. Oh, how she loved romance. But today wasn't about her, it was about helping Cyril enjoy the wonders of pages between the hard cover.

"Cyril!" she called out.

Said boy looked up to spy the snow haired girl and waved her over. "You made it."

"I had time." the violet eyed girl nodded as she took a seat next to him. "So what book did you choose?"

"Uh..."

"R-Right..." Lysithea blush in embarrassment. Cyril can't read. "Well let's see. Oh! You chose a good one. "The Tale of Two Kingdoms. I've read this one before. An epic story about the legendary kingdoms of Nohr and Hoshido. I should warn you this one is a bit complex."

"All the more reason I need to learn." Cyril said.

Lysithea smiled. "Very well." She opened the book to chapter one. "Prologue... Garron the Black King."

-------------------------------------------------
An undisclosed amount of time later.
-------------------------------------------------

"An so then began Princess Corrin's journey of conquest and fate." Cyril read off the page.

"Very good. You're a natural." Lysithea praised.

Her looked away bashfully. "No. You're just a good teacher... Professor."

"P-Professor? Me?" Lysithea squeaked.

Cyril couldn't help but laugh at the mage's reaction. She was redder than a tomato.

"S-shut up." Lysithea said weakly as she nudged her "student's" shoulder. That only made him laugh more. She stood up and began to take her leave. "Forget this. I still have kitchen duty today."

"W-wait! Hahahahahaha! I-I'm sorry." Cyril said between obnoxious laughter.

Lysithea sighed. "It's fine. I really do have kitchen duty today. I was just barely able to squeak this time in. Anyway, you keep practicing. Who knows, maybe you, me, and Annette could start a book club or something."

With her peace said, the mage prodigy of the Golden Deer took her leave. With his teacher gone and his nerves calm, Cyril retuned to his. Just as he was about to start the next chapter he could feel his world begin to spin. At first he chalked it up to a lack of sleep, but it was all to clear something was wrong.

Before he knew it... Everything faded to black. When he came to he noticed he was no longer at his desk with his book in front of him. He was standing on some sort of wooden floor? He took a moment to look around and saw what had become of him. He'd shrunk! Just like his socks when he did laundry for the first time.

"This doesn't seem physically possible!" he shrieked. He had to find help. But at he same time how was he supposed to get down from this wooden platform which he now knew was his chair. The fall alone would kill him.

While the thought of a plan he heard an all too familiar voice humming a gentle tune off in the distance. He turned his head to the source and felt both equal parts fear and relief. Coming his way with books in hand was none other than Lady Rhea herself.

She could help him, right?
1552312331.title: Teeny Tiny Cyril

15523123311.content:
Lady Rhea hummed a sweet tune to herself as she searched for an open seat. It rare for her to take a break like this, and she intended to make the most of it. Where better to relax than in the library where it's nice and quiet with books a plenty?

After humming for another minute or two, she finally spied a good seat. Thankfully it away from the few students that where also occupying this space. This meant she could read her books uninterrupted.

As she made her way over to the open seat, she never even noticed the shrunken form of Cyril crying out for her attention. It would seem the size barrier between the two was just too great. Even so, the shrunken boy wouldn't give up.

"Lady Rhea, please notice me! I'm down here!" He cried. Cyril had even resorted to jumping up and down while the unaware archbishop drew ever closer. Eventually she came to a complete stop.

At first Cyril felt a sense of relief believing the leader of the holy church had finally discovered him and then a sense of awe as he was able to at last take in her full size. Compared to her he was little more than a bug... Perhaps even less than that. He was nothing compared to the beautiful giant before him.

He was only broken from his thoughts when a loud bang filled his ears. Looking u at his 'goddess' he saw that she had only put her books down on the desk, and yet the sound was like that of an explosion to him.

"Huh? Someone left a book here." Lady Rhea noted as she picked up the stray hardcover. "The Tale of Two Kingdoms. Whoever left this behind has great taste."

The Archbishop shut the text and put it off to the side before turning around to take her seat. Down below, Cyril could only scream as the enormous backside of Lady Rhea descended upon. "No! Please! Lady Rhea!"

It was then the holy rear of the Archbishop connected with the seat, turning the once promising young man into an unnoticeable stain beneath her. Cyril's shrunken body never even stood a chance against the full weight of his Lady.

Once she was comfortable enough, the archbishop took a moment to bask in the calm before reaching over to her books. She read through the titles of each until she landed on a red cover with golden letters. "The Path of Radiance, hmm?"

15531.content:
(Heavy spoilers for the Blue Lions route.)

*


The Emperor was alone on their throne.

Enbarr was the beating heart of the Empire, yet the Blue Lions were poised to thrust their lance of reprisal straight through it. No matter what Edelgard had tried, the Kingdom forces had triumphed again and again, and now the prince, the professor and their companions were on their way to the swiftly-abandoned palace to depose her, the grand fortress now as cold and empty as the woman brooding in its seat of power.

Edelgard arose to her feet and slowly walked down the carpeted steps of her altar. With what few remaining subjects she once had long gone and abandoning her to her fate, the throne room was eerily still. As she reached the base of the steps, she advanced further forwards to the device seated in the middle of the space. It was her only remaining ‘attendant’ - a gift from a departed friend.

“Your Highness,” Hubert said, straightening his uniform as he readied himself to depart and face the incoming Kingdom forces. “Our mutual friends and I have devised one more weapon. Unfortunately, it still needs a few hours to finish charging and I cannot delay from the front lines any longer. I ask that you confine it to your throne room as a last resort. And lest you worry, your Crest will shield you from its effects.” A smirk, sly yet genuine, cracked on Hubert’s face. “Not that you’ll need it, of course. I’ll dispose of this Kingdom nuisance myself.”

What remaining of Edelgard gave a sigh. Hubert was still protecting her, even now when all seemed lost.

A vibration rocked the foundations of the palace itself. It was faint and distant, but a herald of what was to come. The Blue Lions. The professor. Dimitri.

Removing her blood-red gloves, the Emperor planted her hand atop the waist-high pillar in the centre of her throne room. The arcane device was coated in a cold black material, with lines ominously pulsating along its surface - pulses which heightened and brightened to Edelgard’s touch. Slowly but surely, a high-pitched sound began to build within its confines, as its magical payload primed itself.

*


Dimitri’s one good eye scanned around the regal surroundings of the imperial palace as the Blue Lions advanced through its halls, passing by its several studies, kitchens and galleries. This was the final front of this horrible war, the last defense of Edelgard and her crumbling empire. But if that was the case, then...

“Where are the guards?” Ashe stated aloud, voicing the concerns of his comrades. The group had an iron grasp on their weapons, ready to lunge out and strike down whatever the Empire had left to throw at them, and yet ever since they broke inside the palace, they hadn’t seen another living soul.

“This could be an ambush,” Dedue reasoned, staying close to his majesty. Felix, following close behind, kept a firm hand on the hilt of his sword. He was eager to cross blades with the Emperor, so he had no intention of being delayed by any inferior Empire lapdogs.

The remaining Blue Lions huddled together, protecting each other’s flanks. “Maybe they’re all watching us through eyeholes in these paintings?” Sylvain joked, nodding his head towards one of the numerous portraits on the walls. Ingrid retorted with a gentle yet swift nudge to the ribs.

Dimitri remained at the head of the pack, the unwavering spear of Areadbhar pointed straight ahead. “It would not be beneath Edelgard to try just about anything by this point. Everyone, stay on your guard.”

Byleth, ever loyal and at their side, nodded in agreement. Edelgard had always been reluctant to surrender, even as a student. The only certainty they had now was that Edelgard would rather die than lose today. Alas, no amount of readiness could have prepared the Blue Lions as they neared the stairs leading to the highest floor.

“Um, professor?” Ingrid said, pushing a lock of blonde hair away from her ear. “I don’t suppose... you hear that?”

Byleth turned their head. “What is it?”

“It sounds like... a ringing noise? Perhaps a whistle, or...?” Ingrid trailed off, the faint sound in her ears too difficult to place.

“Wait, I think I hear it too,” Annette added, concentrating as hard as she could. Mercedes nodded as she heard the same distant yet tangible sound. Soon enough, all of the Blue Lions could feel the trickle of a high-pitched squeal tapping away at their eardrums.

Ashe readied their bow with shaking hands. “What is this? Some sort of spell?”

Byleth drew their sword, the shining relic of bone glowing in their hand. “I don’t know, but brace yourselves.”

Dimitri’s hands began to falter. No matter their resolve and their endurance, the noise was beginning to ring and echo in their skull, as it was for everyone else. The prince shook their head, trying to evade whatever witchcraft was pursuing them, but it wouldn’t leave. Their remaining eye struggled to remain open amidst the nausea and numbing sensation.

Mercedes fell to the ground, already fainting from the unseen attack. “Mercie!” Annette was at her friend’s side in an instant, trying to determine the cause of whatever had struck her, before she too felt her stamina leave her and she slipped into unconsciousness. Felix’s eyes darted around for an enemy to strike down, yet he found none before he fell as well. Even Dedue’s legendary tenacity and stalwart armor didn’t save them as the pulse reached them and forced them down too. Within seconds, the legendary fighting force of the Kingdom had been knocked out, all but its savior king still conscious.

Dimitri fell to one knee, desperately trying to stay awake and vigilant, despite the pounding in his temples. They felt their heart sink as they saw Byleth on the floor as helpless as the rest. “P-Professor! E-El... What have you...?” Dimitri didn’t finish his sentence before he joined Byleth on the cold stone floor.

*


The Emperor removed her hand from the pedestal, barely fazed by the magical pulse thanks to her Crest. She examined her pale-skinned hand for a moment, before steeling herself and returning her red glove to its rightful place.

Edelgard had no regrets for what was about to occur. She was merely disposing of some insects.

15532.content:
Byleth had just joined the academy and wanted to get to know the students before choosing.

After meeting with Edelgard and students for breakfast, and others for lunch, he had invited Claud of the Golden Deer as well as Dimitri of the Blue Lions for dinner. Byleth also invited Linhardt and Caspar of the Black Eagles, and Felix, Ashe, and Sylvain of the Blue Lions. He had also invited Cyril as well.

The boys of the academy ate in enjoyment of their new professor, each in hope of him joining their respective house. What they did not know is that Byleth had put a spell on the food. The food that had been devoured by the 8 future students. The spell was designed to make them grow in both size and strength. Byleth had handpicked the 8 students to grow. Literally grow. However, it came time to tell Lady Reah of his decision on which house he’d be choosing.

The Black Eagles to grow Caspar and Linhardt,

The Blue Lions to grow Demitri, Ashe, Felix, Sylvain, and Cyril,

Or The Golden Deer to grow Claud and Cyril?

Luckily, he could convince the others, aside from Demitri and Claud, to join his classes regardless of the house, and all of the 8 boys, and only the 8 of them, would grow regardless of which house he would choose.
15532.title: The Growing House

155322.content:
Why did Byleth do something like that? Fetishism? Of course not...

It was his biggest secret: He had seen the future, a alternative timeline in which many of his students died and traveled 5 years back in time to avoid it. The spirit Sothis, still in his head, taught him a spell fueled by her power that could make a limited number of human as strong as titans, strong enough to stop their terrible future. Byleth, incapable of forgetting his student's deaths, chose 8 of them hopping this power would protect them and gave it secretly, as no one of them would believe his story.

He watched how the eight devoured the dishes and felt disappointed when he did not see any sign of change between them.

"I could remember the spell, but I don't remember the exact details of how it works." Sothis admitted in the shadows of Byleth's mind. "Maybe it'd take some time, maybe years, before they get the divine strength."

The teacher wondered, bitterly, if the approaching war would hit before their transformations. After saying farewell he spent a terrible night in his old new bedroom, the little sleep he got was filled with nightmares of the future.

The next day he was informed he couldn't delay more his decision regarding which house he would join. He met the head students of the houses and again was disappointed by the lack of visible changes.

"It's a pleasure to met you again, professor. I really enjoyed the dinner." The always polite blond prince was the first one in shaking hands with his new teacher.

Then it happened: Pain... he could feel Dimitri's hand squeezing Byleth's tighter than he could bear. He heard bones creaking, but it wasn't his hand, that came from Dimitri's body who was slowly growing bigger while he kept in a trance with his eyes closed. As he was gained inches in height, his shoulders broadened, muscle mass was added in his bigger frame and feet grew 2 sizes, not enough to break his shoes but enough to feel uncomfortable.

It ended before anyone, not even Dimitri, could notice the abnormal growth spurt. The prince, who was 5cm (2") taller than the teacher, had almost a head of advantage over him.His clothes looked snugger on him and it didn't cover all his wrists and ankles. Byleth couldn't be happier.

"A good omen... a signal of what house I should choose."

And so, he turned into the head teacher of the Blue Lions, expecting to guide them as they grew into titanic saviors.
While they were leaving the garden, Claude's yawning attracted Byleth's attention. Feeling a bit uncomfortable, he was stretching his arms, and while he was doing it the rest of his body stretched slowly upwards until he was a hair under Dimitri's.

Smiling, Byleth remembered he had to keep an eye on the other houses...

Despite their different houses and appearances, they shared a lot, like their love for physical training, and frequently did they routines together.

Although Caspar hadn't experimented any change due the spell, he felt strangely energetic since the dinner and couldn't stop working out, to the point Raphael had to ask him to stop.

"What? We've just started!"
"No, we've been sparring for 2 hours... uff!" The blond giant replied, panting and covered in sweat, whereas his tiny blue haired companion was perfectly fine.

While Raphael was picking up his weapons, a strange feeling overcame the shorty. It was like his body had taken a jump, but his feet didn't left the floor. His perspective seemed a little off... like it was higher?

"Weird... It must be fatigue. Raphael is right, I'm overdoing it."

He agreed to stop too and then the pair left the room together.

"You know... I really envy you, Raphael... You're huge!"

Chitchat.

"I know I'm big. Everyone knows that. What are you talking about?"
"I'm not very big, but I've always wanted to be. That's why I train so much. I've grown a bit in the last five years, but I'm still not even close to you. I just don't know how to bulk up."
"You're not so small." The friendly giant noted. His blue head, who previously was at the same height of his collar bone, was close to the other's square jaw.

============

Class time. Byleth was trying to teach his courses, but often he was interrupted by noises.

First it was Sylvain's knees suddently bumping against the bottom of the table. Fitting his legs under the table was becoming harder and harder as the class went on.

"Sorry, teach."

Byleth didn't say a thing and continued, although kept an eye on him and the other male students.

*riiiip*

Ashe's uniform teared from behind when he extended his arm to receive a pencil from Annette.

The former thief blushed a little, ashamed. A slight smile appeared in Byleth's face, disappearing when he resumed the class.

"...mn..."

Byleth eyes were drawn to a grumpy swordsman, whose face looked troubled and uncomfortable. Without interrupting his speech, the teacher kept watching Felix until he hit the table in a muscular spasm caused by an instantaneous growth spurt.

"...sorry."

Byleth couldn't calculate his height while he was sitting, he seemed a good head taller and his muscles had increased enough to be noticed under his uniform.

He heard a few ripping sounds before the period ended with diminishing intensity.

"Has the spell lost its effect? Are they reaching their maximum sizes?" The inexpressive man grew worried. His students seemed stronger, but not with the legendarily strength Sothis described.

"Teacher, I have a question..." Ashe approached to him. He hadn't changed much, maybe a bit taller and considerabily more muscular without reaching Felix's level.

Then he froze halfway, with an expression similar as one who is going to sneeze. Then it happened.
An explosive growth spurt make him rise 30cm (1') in addition to the 7cm (3") he had gained in his seat. And the previously slim boy's muscles grew out of porpotion,ripping every seam in his clothes, which fell to the ground as shreds.

The only cloth that remained in his place was his underwear because he hold the damaged cloth with his huge hands.

His freckled skin turned fire red and escaped through the door.

"Wait..."

Byleth heard screams and knew he had been seen by all the people outside the classroom. "At this hour there are a lot of deer and eagles outside."
The huge teen took refuge inside. The other students were surprisingly supportive and calming with him, despite some looked a bit unconfortable and others were peeping discreetly the almost nude boy.

"It's not your fault, it's the school's!" Sylvain exclaimed, patting on his broad back.
"...what?" Byleth thought scared his secret had been found out.
"...their uniforms are awful! They're ripping every time we breathe, and clearly they’re not as 'custom sized' as they advertise." The redhead showed them his ankles, exposed after his legs grew longer than his trousers.

"Are they really so oblivious?" The avatar wondered.
"The effects of the spell can't be easily appreciated by mortals, even the ones affected by them... most won't notice any change, and the ones who did will automatically accept it as normal."

Sothis spoke to him from her realm.

"Answering your previous doubt, the growth isn't going to stop any time soon. They're going to get stronger... MUCH stronger... before the spell stops."
"When will that happen? The stopping?"
"I... don't remember."

Next day, in the canteen...

"Now sit down and eat up! Eating's the best way to get bigger!" Raphael was doing his best to help his friend to be as big as him, despite that wasn't a pressing matter after the previous day's growth spurt.
"Let's do it! I'm gonna eat till I can't move!"

Caspar did indeed he ate and ate until the cookers refused to keep serving him. Raphael watched amazed how his piled dishes doubled his own.

"Wow, and I thought I was a big eater!"

Caspar ignored him as he felt the urgency of stretching his body... and his body did actually stretch taller during the stretching, his head rose slowly as his legs extended further under the table. *Pop* *Pop* The shoes bursted as his feet lengthened 12cm (5").

"Mmmm... just what I needed." Caspar felt amazing, and the ripped clothes felt less constrictive. "Hey, Raphael, let's train a little more!"
"Wait, now?"

But he was dragged by the growing teen, who was now a few centimeters shorter than him.

Hours later, Byleth was coming from a reunion when he met a curious pair... Raphael, who looked like shit after being beaten up by Caspar, who was being helping him to walk to the infirmary, holding him as he apologized nonstop.

"Forgive me, Raphael, I didn't want to hit him so hard!" He said with a trembling, guilty voice.

The blue haired boy was A HEAD AND A QUARTER TALLER than the blond one, and as muscular if not more. The sensation of approaching growth had reduced after that huge growth spurt... although it could and would come back later.

"I have to check the other houses too." Byleth said to himself, as much surprised as satisfied by the results.

The inexperienced teacher returned to his room and got another surprise... a pretty big boy was sleeping on his bed.

"Linhardt."
"Zzz"
"Wake up..."
"...5 minutes more, mom... zzz."
"Why aren't you in your bedroom?"
"...my bed is too small... yours is bigger... zz..."

That was privilege of the academy teachers. Byleth tried to move the mage, but he was heavier than he looked. He was taller too, as his feet were close to the end of Byleth big almost-double bed. He would never fit in a student's bed.

"Damn it, Linhardt."

At this point, Byleth had no more options than left him spend the night in his room. With the academy closed, he had little options: Sleeping with him or go to his empty room and risking be spotted by other students and have to answer very inconvenient questions...

"His face is peaceful, like an angel... a huge lazy angel."

Again, a smile was put on his face, although this time it lasted longer.

"You're not going to take advantage of a student, right?" Sothis' voice, always talking at the worst moment possible.
"Of course not! I'm just going to share my bed to sleep and nothing more. Good night!" He didn’t want to continue that conversation… because although Byleth would never do something like that, there was so much history between those two: in the previous timeline, a sweet story with a bitter end.

"Maybe, after the graduation, that story can have a happier ending..."
1553221.title: Goliath vs GigaDavid

15532211.content:
The bed was bigger than a single man would need, but a little too narrow for two persons, specially when one of them was close to the 2m (6'7") mark.

Byleth moved himself to the border of the bed, giving the teen all the space he could. As usual, Linhardt felt asleep instantly. The teacher needed a little more time, but eventually shut his eyes too.

Or, at least until the mage waked him up in the wee hours. Still sleeping, the young man was hugging him like he was a teddy bear, clinging his arms to his thorax, with the teacher's face was pressing his broad shoulders. Breathing was

He tried to free himself from his embrace, but despite being asleep the boy showed a strength beyond his own. Even worse, his efforts only made Linhardt to grab him tighter, and he was sleeping so deeply he couldn't wake him up, like always.

"How can this get worse?"
"Mmm..."

A sound of cracking and rips. Soft moans. The student's body agitated and seemed like it was surrounding Byleth's more, sinking his face on his thick chest...

"Is he... growing?"

Yes, he was.

His longer legs stuck out the bed, with his long feet and ankles exposed to the coldness of the night. He instinctively bent his legs to shelter them under the blankets, and so Byleth ended up not only surrounded by his arms, also by his thicker, longer legs. Too intimate for him to feel comfortable.

The growth stopped one minute after it started, but the boy had clearly gained enough muscle and size to look more like a brawler than a mage.

Unable to escape, Byleth's only option was to wait to the sunrise resting in his toned arms.

"It's cozier than I thought..."

The night ended and the combination of the alarm, the massive daylight and Byleth's screams were just enough to wake the sleepyhead.

He released the teacher and stretched his body, touching the high ceiling with his arms.

"Mmm... I've never slept so well like yesterday! I love this bed!"

He didn't seem to remember the night long hug, and Byleth was too embarrassed to tell him.

"Don't get used to. Tonight you have to use yours." Byleth said really seriously.
"But my bed is too small!"
"Mine is becoming too small for you too."

The student checked it out and noticed his feet hung at the end of it.

"I don't know where I'm going to sleep now." He said extremely worried.
"Can't you request a bigger one?"
"I've already tried that yesterday, but the school said I have to resign to use the one they assigned to me. My title of nobility doesn't give me any privilege here, apparently."
"Oh..."

Enough chitchat. Byleth still have to get him out his room discretely. A student spending a night with a teacher was weird, and probably would get him fired.

Plus, Linhardt's pajama was partly ripped and was too short to cover his newfound six pack... if anyone saw him poorly dressed like this in his company...

Fortunately there was no one around at this time of the morning, so he managed to send Linhardt to his room without being seen.

[The support Level between Byleth and Linhardt has increased]

Later, Linhardt and the much bigger Caspar spent an hour training.

"Damn, you're invincible today. I surrender." Linhardt admited after receiving so many blows, he could have endured more, but he was too lazy to that kind of heavy training Caspar had forced him to participate.
"At least, I won! That's prove your theory was wrong!"
"What theory?"
"That thing about tall warriors having advantage over shorter guys."
"Well..."

He put his palm on the top of his head and moved it straightforward towards Caspar. The hand landed between his chest and his neck
Caspar hadn't really realiced how tall he was until that moment. If Linhardt was around 7 feet tall (213cm), Caspar was close to 8 feet tall (240cm) now.

"Oh... right, I'm taller than you, and I beat you, so you were right... SO COOL! I LOVE BEING THE BIG GUY FOR ONCE!! AND THE STRONGEST!!"
"Don't let it go to your head... My father is taller than yours, I'm sure I'll surpass you soon." He said a bit irritated. He wasn't aware of his nocturnal growth yet.
"Oh, I'd love to see that." Caspar smirked, and rub the hair of his smaller friend like he was a little brother to bother.

Meanwhile, Byleth was working on an idea he had to fix Linhardt's bedroom problem, and avoid the previous night to repeat again.
The academy was reluctant to spend money in what they consider students' whims, but he could use his position as a teacher and Lady Rhea's favourite to get the boy a bed as huge as him.

"The school board have bought and installed you bed, Byleth... but I have to say a member of the church shouldn't take advantage of its money." Seteth, as grumpy as always.

Byleth ran to his room and saw a beautiful, opulent, spacious bed took up almost half of the chamber. It was perfect for the lazy student, who wouldn't outgrow it for a time... and when he did, he probably also outgrew the room itself.

The only remaining problem was how he would translate that bed into Linhardt's bedroom. The servants had bring its pieces to his place because he was the one who had ordered up, and then they assembled the pieces.

Now it was mounted, it didn't fit through the door and couldn’t be dismantled it either.

"Does this mean... he's going to sleep in my bedroom from now on?"

Yes, and Byleth was the official teddy bear of this growing teen.
15532211.title: A good night's sleep... for Linhardt, not Byleth

info.brief_description: Size stories featuring the characters from Fire Emblem: Three Houses
info.description:
Three Houses is the latest addition of the longstanding Fire Emblem series. The story chronicles the events between three conflicting nations stemming from an eventful year at a military academy. The game features a wide and colorful cast of characters that are fun enough to want to see in size changing scenarios.

Guidelines:

1. Put some effort in. I'm grateful for any additions, but low quality/effort additions will be removed.
2. Mark your spoiler warnings at the top of the chapter. Use a chapter number or month or any identification of time/story route.
3. Keep the characters in character. That's kinda the whole point of this thing.
4. For lewd chapters, make sure the characters are at least 18. For the younger characters like Lysithea and Petra, reserve 18+ rated chapters featuring them for post timeskip.

Have fun friendos. Hopefully this interactive catches on like the Persona one. Also pray for me and my free time. I'm gonna try to support both equally, but I want to see this one grow at the moment.
